Reviews.Title: Amazing TV with great DLNA capabilities
Reviews.Author: azs
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  It has a fantastic picture with really bright, vivid colors.  Everyone who sees it comments on its classy look and super thin profile.  I'm not sure if the LED lighting produces a better or brighter picture than standard LCDs, but I believe it's worth it simply for the thin profile and lower energy use.  We used the built-in speakers for awhile until we got a sound system, and they worked plenty well and were loud enough.Some people complain about "flash lighting" or "clouding" with these edge-lit LED TVs.  I can say this hasn't been a problem for me.  With standard day-to-day full color scenes you won't see the lights at all.  You also won't see them on a nearly all black screen, for example movie credits or an app's splash screen, and actually get a very deep, OLED-like black, I'm guessing because the TV is detecting the dark scene and adjusting the LEDs dynamically.  You might only ever see it very faintly in the corners of a widescreen movie with letterbox or on other occasional dark backgrounds, but it's not very noticeable unless you're looking for it.  The backlight brightness doesn't need to be as high as it's set to out of the box and turning it down a bit definitely makes a difference.  All in all it's completely fine to me and I'm glad I didn't spend several hundred more on a unit with local dimming or a full LED array.The other important point is this TV's DLNA capabilities, as this was something that was important to me but was hard to find information about online.  I wanted to use this TV to play videos from my computer to avoiding building an HTPC or buying a dedicated media streamer for the purpose.  I can say that the TV does the job admirably and I have had no need to build or buy another device.  The TV supports high-bitrate MKVs with AC3 and DTS audio.  The only quirk is that it thinks it doesn't know the MKV container format, even though it really does.  The solution to this is simple.  You can either just rename MKVs to AVI, no transcoding necessary, or just enable transcoding in your DLNA server software.  I use Serviio, and I bet the "transcoding" it does is really just switching the container format silently for me.  I can't be certain of that, all I know is that MKVs work and the quality looks untouched on the TV.  If you don't use something that offers transcoding, the simple rename will do the trick.  The TV can also handle and output 5.1 audio formats just fine.  Once the video is playing, simply go to the sound settings menu and switch the SPDIF output from PCM to either DTS or Dolby Digital, then connect the TV's optical port to your receiver, and you're done.  Normal fast forward and rewind don't work over DLNA, but it's not a problem - you can pause and play, use the left and right arrows to skip forward or back a certain increment (maybe 30 seconds or something), or you can use the "time search" feature to skip around anywhere in the video.  In this respect, the TV's an even better MKV player than Windows Media Center would be, as it seems all that can do is skip in increments.Overall a handsome unit with a great picture, fine speakers if you use them, and solid DLNA capabilities that should replace the need for an HTPC or dedicated media streamer.

Reviews.Title: Light bleeding problems
Reviews.Author: Stefan
Reviews.Content: I bought this LED at a local Fred Meyer after reading reviews here on Amazon and other websites. It's a beautiful looking TV, with a very stylish and slick design. It's ultra-thin and all around very nice to look at. Picture quality was actually very good. Although, when you turn on Auto-motion plus (which is designed to reduce blurring and jarring during panned shots) it felt as if you're watching something that was filmed with a cheap handheld camera. Sort of like a soap-opera. After complaining about this at the store, I was told to turn this feature off during movies, which helped. And apparently all LCD/LED TVs that have a similar built in system, have a similar effect when it's turned on.The first issue I had was that I had a lot of trouble getting the sound from my home-theater system to synch with the TV. After adjusting both the TV synching and the home theater synching to the max I got it to a point where it was 'okay' and not so noticeable any longer. Samsung's support was of excellent help with this.My main criticism concerns the light 'bleeding' from all four corners of the screen. My understanding is that many LED TVs have LED lights along their edges only (hence the nomenclature 'edge-lit LED') instead of behind the entire screen, which allows the TVs to become ultra thin. The light is then send from the edges to the center of the TV via some kind of mechanism to backlight the entire image. Well, with this Samsung TV you could clearly see all four corners being a lighter, grey-ish sort of color instead of the dark black that the rest of the image was. It was very distracting during any darker scenes in a movie. The light was literally seeping thru. After I read more reviews online, I realized that this wasn't just a fluke with my particular TV, but that it seemed to be an inherent flaw with the design of this model.I ended up returning the TV (huge struggle in and off itself since Fred Meyer doesn't do returns on open box electronics any longer) and bought an LG TV at Costco instead. So far, I'm very happy with the LG.I would NOT recommend the Samsung TV to anyone, unless you're not bothered by light grey corners.

Reviews.Title: The Samsung UN40D6000 a Great Technological Advance
Reviews.Author: Tom Thompson
Reviews.Content: I have had this magnificent product for two months and I am very pleased with it. It was two weeks before I was able to receive HD programing and during that time it was almost as awesome as it is now with the HD programming. I am of an older generation but have been into technology since the early eightys and I still marvel at the advances that are being made today. Let's hope it has longevity to add to it's attractiveness.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture but needs adjusting from factory setup for best picture
Reviews.Author: stockmarketbob
Reviews.Content: After buying the 7000 series for the media room, I decided to try the 6000 for my bedroom TV to save some money.  Picture quality compares well to the more expensive 7000.  As Consumer Reports points out, this set suffers from uneven LED perimeter edge lighting, but to me it's only visible against a solid black background, and it is undetectable during normal viewing.  The 7000 does not have this minor ailment.  Audio is just OK, which is understandable when you have 2 small speakers facing out of the back of the set, however, boosting the midrange helps considerable.  If you are extremely annoyed as I was with the factory setting of "on" for the "smooth-motion" effect which yields an artificial 3D fake-live type of video, I suggest turning off the smooth-motion adjustment.  This set won't disappoint if you take the time to make the audio and video adjustments mentioned.  I worked in the TV business mastering HD TV shows, and in my opinion the Samsung LED's are the best for HD picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV with extra features
Reviews.Author: Robert Fair "RFair2"
Reviews.Content: I've owned my Samsung 6000 series HDTV for three weeks now and love it.  Picture quality is wonderful.  Sound quality is poor, but this is my first flat screen and my first to hang on a wall so I don't know how it compares to other flat screens.  Compared to old-style TVs the sounds quality from the tiny speakers is not very good.  But then I didn't buy a 60" super thin HDTV for sound quality.Mounting was easy.  I searched Amazon for a wall mount for a 60" flat screen but couldn't find what I wanted.  Settled on a Cheetah mount cheetah Mounts 32"-55" LCD TV Wall Mount Bracket with Full Motion Swing Out Tilt & Swivel Articulating Arm for Flat Screen Flat Panel LCD LED Plasma TV and Monitor Displays APSAMBthat was advertised to work on up to 55" screens (and up to 150 lbs) and it worked perfectly.My only other complaint is that Samsung's "Allshare" software is unnecessarily difficult to use.  It took hours to set it up properly but it now works very well.  I have a large movie collection in divx format stored on a Windows XP computer and the Allshare allows the TV to play them directly over my wired network.  It also plays .vob (DVD format) files.  Very convenient.  Streaming Netflix works well too.Overall I give it four out of five stars (sound quality the only reason it's missing the fifth star) and I'd would buy it again.  Did I mention the picture is amazing?

Reviews.Title: This TV is beautiful
Reviews.Author: ninjadancer
Reviews.Content: I had been searching for a new TV for a pretty long time since my whole family passed me with larger TVs, I had still been using my 32" Bravia while my family upgraded to 40"+ Tvs. I shopped around for 5 months debating on Lcd or Lcd/Led lit tvs. After shopping around I almost went for a sony 46" but it was a 2010 model. Long story short I waited for memorial day for a hopeful sale and nothing then the price on this dropped to $999 so I bit the bullet. I am amazingly happy with my purchase the TV looks beautiful and the bezel is nice. The base was slightly off when i mounted the TV like a previous customer said but its hardly noticeable. The Picture is amazing and clear. Tried blu rays on my PS3 and the 120hz refresh rate looks amazing. Standard definition tv still looks crappy but it cant really be helped. Response time for video games is on par of regular lcd tvs. I had game mode on and Modern Warfare 2 played fluid without lag. So if you are in the market for a new tv around this size i would recommend this samsung you wont be disappointed6/30/11 UpdateAfter a month of Owning this T.V I havent had any problems at all, no crackling noises or backlight bleeding. I must say for the ammount paid on the TV this was a great purchase and I am very happy. Blu rays look amazing and I have no lag when playing xbox.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor sound quality, buggy SmartTV portal
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: This TV has great picture quality, but is very expensive, has tinny sound quality, and has a half-baked connected TV platform ("SmartTV"). Note that this TV does NOT have wireless internet connection built it; you have to buy the separate adapter.Setting up the wireless connection was a snap, but downloading the SmartTV apps was time consuming and confusing for those that required a separate account set up (Pandora, Netflix, Picassa, etc.). You also have to use an "on screen keyboard", which is painful and slow when you have to enter email addresses and passwords for each individual app. But the worst experience was the ESPN app, which kept popping up over the TV program and could not be disabled. After 30 minutes on the phone with Samsung tech support (very friendly), I had to reset my SmartTV platform and start over downloading all of the apps and setting them up! Apparently you cannot delete individual apps once you've downloaded - a major oversight!I'm sure you can find a TV with comparable picture quality for half the price, and I don't think the buggy SmartTV portal is worth the $450 premium.

Reviews.Title: Short & Sweet Review of UN55D6000SFXZ
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep it short and simple.Samsung UN55D6000 Edge Lit LED (Smart) TVI bought this from Best Buy for $1300.Pros:- Second to none picture quality. 4/5- Speaker sound is like any other HDTV (can't say & didn't expect much)- Plays most video files (avi,mpeg,mp4,even mkv) through usb also mp3s and loads several other photo files.- Less power consumption- No serious blur or juddering- Menu is easy to follow- Split screen video sources. eg. Can play games while watching TV also.Cons:- I don't know if anyone else experienced this, but when I first powered on the TV for the first time and played a PS3 game on it, the game was lagging so much that I was seriously considering returning the TV. But after the second day the lagging seemed to stop. My guess is that it was a software glitch.- Smart Hub is pretty slow, also when browsing movies,music, or photos on USB devices.- Have to buy Samsung Dongle in order to connect wirelessly to internet.The biggest and most serious CON:Screen Uniformity aka flashlighting!!! (this is a known issue by Samsung 5,6,7,8 series and many other edge lit TVs)All four corners have bright noticeable lights when watching widescreen movies (movies with the black bars) especially in a dark room/at night.Only way to reduce the light is to turn down the dynamic contrast, this means sacrificing the sweet LED picture contrast (whats the point of having it in the first place, if you can't enjoy it to its full potential?).For me personally the cons outweighs the bad. I bought this TV almost %50 off from its original price so I'm not that upset about it. But if you are going to spend close to $2,000 for this model, I would advise you to not buy this TV. It really is a spit to the face when a major flaw like this exist in these Edge Lit TVS and Samsung says "It is normal." No! this is not how a TV should normally be viewed because it so distracting to the human eyes.

Reviews.Title: Not completely Happy...Nothing like CLOUDS!
Reviews.Author: Luigi Chincochento "Fiataly"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung LED TV and I'm not COMPLETELY happy with my purchase.  First of all, I used to have a 55" LCD 850 Series which was purchased back in 2009.  That TV also had the same issue as this TV.To start, I called Samsung to complain about a clouding effect which is the main reason for my 3 Star Review.  My definition of clouding is the white effect in a totally black screen when watching movies, viewing your laptop, etc.  I had light coming through all four corners of the screen, and also some white (appearing as clouds) throughout the middle of the screen.  I would have thought after two years when the 55" 850 Series was purchased that this issue would have finally been corrected; Apparently not!When I called Samsung, they began trouble shooting the TV.  After the trouble shooting failed, they immediately scheduled an authorized Samsung dealer to contact me in regards to the issue, and have it serviced immediately.  A new panel was ordered (which happened to take over a week) and then installed.  Honestly, clouding seems to be worse compared to the original panel.  So as you can imagine, I am not at ALL happy about this.  And just for reference, the back-light is set to 13 and the contrast is set to 95, which is what the Authorized Dealer suggested.  Well guess what...I can still see the clouds.My other complaint on the TV is the remote.  IMHO, the center/enter button which is surrounded by the up/down left/right arrows (navigation buttons) should be raised.  At night, I don't want to look at my remote to make sure I'm pressing the center/enter button.  This is somewhat of a nuisance and think this button could have been engineered much better.Additionally, digital streaming of movies through Amazon Prime is not compatible.  So your Prime Membership will not work with this TV if you are looking to stream movies from Amazon.Apps are slow to load most of the time.  No way to download apps that I want, including Amazon Prime and Yahoo.Other than that, I will update this review as needed since I purchased the TV September 1st, and today is October 7th, 2011.*****************************************************************************************************************************December 8th, 2011 UPDATE:  Due to my ongoing problems with "clouds" after a Samsung Authorized Service Center replaced my LCD Panel (clouds were worse), Samsung's Executive Service Department contacted me and so far I have been pleased with the communications.  They offered to send me out a replacement TV and due to my inconvenience, they are upgrading my model to the 6300.  The only difference is that this TV will have a web browser where the 6000 does not.  I probably could have gotten a 3D TV had I asked, but wasn't interested in the technology at this time being that it is so new.  Not to mention, extended 3D viewing can't be real good for your eyes.  I will keep everyone updated once I receive my replacement TV.  One thing is certain -- Samsung does stand behind their product and goes the extra mile to make things right.*******************************************************************************************************************************December 19th, 2011 UPDATE:  Received new TV today.  However, it is the 6000 Series and not the 6300 as they promised and documented.  Made a call to Samsung and they were apologetic.  They are shipping out ANOTHER TV along with a $50 Best Buy Gift Card.  Hopefully, it's the right model this time and hopefully the card will have money on it.  ;o)  If not, maybe I'll just call again and push for a 55" big screen.  AYE YAI YAI...*******************************************************************************************************************************December 20th, 2011 UPDATE:  I received a phone call from a different representative today, and she requested that I take a picture of the tag on the back of the TV that shows the Model # and Serial #, although I recited this information to a previous supervisor/manager yesterday.  She said they would not be sending out the replacement TV until this information was provided.  As you could imagine, I about went into orbit.  So, I demanded to speak with another manager in the Executive Relations Department.  After a long hold, the manager finally got on the phone.  She asked what she could do, and I told her "Let's just forget about it.  Pick up your TV and refund my money.  I don't need to be inconvenienced any further and take offense to this ridiculous request, as though I'm being dishonest.  Further, I supplied the information from the back of the TV to another manager/supervisor and she confirmed that this was the TV that was sent to me, and that it is absolutely positively the 6000 model.  Let's just call it a day and I'll buy from a different manufacturer."At this point, I don't think she liked the thought of losing me as a customer.  So she extended this offer:  With her sincere apology and everything I have gone through, she will now move me into the 7000 Series, and she was even willing to give me a bigger screen size.  I told her that it wouldn't be necessary and I'll stick with the 40".  For my inconvenience, she is sending me a 7000 Series with the $50 Best Buy Gift Card as was previously promised to me.  Although I didn't want a 3D model, I appreciated the gesture and accepted.  Now let's see if I get the right model this time!*********************************************************************************************************************************December 26th, 2011 UPDATE: Well, what a belated Merry Christmas to me. Today I received the Samsung 7000 Series TV, in a 46". So far, the TV and remote are AWESOME! I am very happy. And finally, NO CLOUDS!!! There is some light coming in from the four corners and this I can live with. No more white light clouding effect in the middle or other parts of the screen!!!  The manager/supervisor called me today and we chatted. I informed her that I was just on my way back from Best Buy as I had to purchase a new Full-Motion Wall Mount, as my previous mount would not work for the 46". She stated that they had no more 40" / 7000 Series in the warehouse (I didn't think they even existed, but didn't argue) and that I was actually supposed to receive it on Wednesday. She was happy to hear that I received it so quickly and also advised me that my Best Buy Gift card would be increased to $100 and that should cover the majority of the 3D glasses. She stated if I have any further problems, that she will go ahead and put me in the 7900 Series if needed. I was very appreciative, so we'll see how everything goes from this point on. Because of this, I have upgraded my rating from 3 to 4 stars and Samsung has once again earned my business. Thanks again Kateland!!!

Reviews.Title: THIS TV NOT AMAZON PRIME COMPATABLE!
Reviews.Author: Don C
Reviews.Content: To my surprise 6000 series Samsung TV's "are not compatible" with the amazon app.. per Samsung.It does have easy internet connection for other services, Just not Amazon!However the TV performance is great......

Reviews.Title: was an AMAZING TV, but now there is a problem.
Reviews.Author: mike49
Reviews.Content: I have a samsung 40C6300 as well as a samsung 55C7000. This TV is much better then last years c6300 when it comes to picture quality and sound. the sound is surprisingly  very good, when set to movie mode. If your a gammer you will not be disappointed at all, and obviously blu rays look amazing. for under $900 you really cant go wrong, its an amazing buy.EDIT: ok so i've had this tv for a about a month, and out of the blue when i turn on the tv, it would turn off after 15 seconds. also there was 1 more problem, if your familiar with family guy u will understand what im talking about. when watching family guy i noticed that when the character brian  would walk, the black in his nose would "burn in"  and there would be a black trail following him. like a flip book effect or something. i've never seen anything like this before and i began noticing it in video games and other cartoons. when ever there is a dark image over a light image, and it is moving, you will see a fading burn in effect as it moves. wiI really liked this tv but im going to have to send it back.I have sent this tv back and i received my refund on the same day as they received it. well done amazon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value but does not stream Amazon video
Reviews.Author: Mark K. Mellis
Reviews.Content: This is my third Samsung television and it is excellent in every way save one: although it is listed as having Samsung Apps as one of its features, and in spite of the fact that other Samsung LED TVs in this set's class have an app that allows them to stream Amazon videos, this set does not. It does stream Netflix and Hulu Plus, along with other video sources, so one is left with the impression that there is no technical reason for this restriction.When I contacted Samsung and Amazon support, neither organization offered any hope in this matter. Samsung implied that the reason for the limitation was that only Series 7 and higher TVs can stream Amazon video, but according to the qualified TV list on Amazon's site, the following "non-Series-7" TVs all can stream their video: UN32C6500, UN40C6400, UN40C6500, UN46C6400, UN46C6500, UN55C6400, UN55C6500, UN60C6400, and UN65C6500. I am not sure what the real issue is, but I am disappointed that the capability has been omitted. From the feature comparison lists on the Samsung and Amazon sites it is not obvious that this limitation exists.If being able to stream Amazon video without external equipment, additional remote controls, and wires, is important to you (for example, if you are an Amazon Prime customer), I suggest you look at a different model or brand. If that isn't important, then this is an excellent TV and you will almost certainly be pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: LED TV as PC game monitor
Reviews.Author: Commodity Junkie
Reviews.Content: I use this TV as my primary PC monitor, with my old Samsung T260 as an extended display.  The UN32D6000 delivers results that are perfectly respectable, and better than I expected. But still, not exceedingly so.**In this review, I won't be offering any insights or comments regarding the UN32D6000's performance as a television for cable, sports, & movies or Samsung's SmartHub features.**At first, I used a DVI-cable with a VGA-connector as my main input.  With a bit of adjustment, the TV did well enough when compared to a standard computer monitor - internet and document text came through clean with little to no initial blurring.  Pictures were vivid and colorful.  And, as this is a television, the viewing angles were far and beyond an improvement over monitors.**For you amateur and professional photographers, however: LCD TVs don't deliver the high quality color spectrum control or pixel density that LCD monitors provide.**Going back to PC gaming: I ran into awful latency issues while using a DVI cable.  The frame stuttering and lags made me cringe at the thought of having tanked $700. I scoured the internet for hours looking for answers, and came up with little or nothing.  A call to Samsung customer service didn't fix anything, either.The workaround proved to be an HDMI cable.  And that's all it took to solve my latency problem.  Note, your computer should include an HDMI-input and HDMI-compatible video adapter in order to make this workable.In brief:1.) the HDMI-cable was connected to the 'HDMI 1/DVI' port2.) the remote control was used to scan for a 'Source' - just press the 'Source' button3.) I selected the port in use - 'HDMI 1/DVI' and hit the remote's 'Tools' button4.) there's a feature to 'Edit Name'5.) once in the 'Edit Name' menu, I selected 'DVI PC' in the list6.) this adjustment can be made to set the viewing mode for different activities as well, e.g. there's 'Blu-Ray', 'Camcorder', 'HD DVD', et al.This turned out to be the best choice by far.  After playing countless hours of 'Batman: Arkham City', 'Battlefield 3', 'Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2', 'Skyrim', & 'The Witcher 2' - lagging turned into an absent memory.**For all you console gamers: this Samsung does provide a 'Game Mode' in the main menu - when in use with an HDMI cable - that will work hand-in-hand with your Xbox, PS, or Wii.  Again, this is meant for use with consoles.  Enabling 'Game Mode' on a PC did not deliver the results I wanted, and was largely disappointing.**In summary, I was looking for a large display, but didn't want to fork over $$$$ for a 30" NEC or Dell monitor.  And, as an avid PC gamer - generally spending upwards of $2K whenever building a new computer - I was looking to spend money, but not extravagantly so.  With the UN32D6000, I seemed to have found a happy median.UPDATE: 1 year 3 months, and still going.

Reviews.Title: Vibrant life-like images.
Reviews.Author: D. Barnard
Reviews.Content: Purchased this set and have been amazed with the image quality, ease of setup, and variety of options especialy given the pricing. After a few minor adjustments the picture appears to be a window with live actors rather than a television. Found same exact model last night at a place claiming to be the best place to buy electronics for $200 more, and without Amazon Prime's delivery and return benefits. The unit I received also boasts 240Hz Clear Motion Rate rather than the indicated 120Hz.The "flashlight effect" in the corners is just barely noticable in a very dark room when veiwing letterboxed movies and does not detract from our enjoyment. Using Eco-Sense diminishes the effect, but at the cost of too much brilliance and vibrancy in our opinion.The sound quality is rather weak, but the Samsung HW-D450 Sound Bar has been extremely impressive.The remote control is comprehensive but lacks tactile feel of frequently used buttons, you have to look at it to navigate even the simplest options. Simply raising the "OK" button at the center of the direction arrows would help tremendously.There's no wireless connectivity, but we coupled it with the Samsung BD-D5700 Blu-Ray player so that in itself is not an issue.Purchase this unit with no reservations, it occupies a beautiful sweet-spot of price to performance that is hard to beat. I would happily purchase this unit again.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: boney1
Reviews.Content: Ive only had this for a week but i spent a month looking in stores at different tv's and Samsung is clearly the best picture ever. the clarity and brightness is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Best TV on the Market
Reviews.Author: Gafoe
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my new Samsung 55" LED, now I need to go to a company that is 100% digital.  The HD channel are so clear that they almost look 3D.  Any analog channels, the TV shows ALL the imperfections.  I have it hanging on the wall with $35 wall mount from Amazon and it is AWESOME.  Speakers are in the back and are OK but if you have a good surround sound system (I would rank mine way above average), you do not need to go to the movies anymore except to watch 3D movies.  If you want 3D or direct wifi you need to move up on Samsungs TVs, but this one is wonderful for the money ($1400).

Reviews.Title: Great HD - not that Smart
Reviews.Author: entropy_generator
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice TV.  However, there are wrinkles you might want to consider:1.  Not all Samsung Smart TVs are the same - even within a given series.  The 6000 series will NOT do Amazon VOD (because it doesn't support the Yahoo! Widgets).  The literature will lead you to believe otherwise.  This has to be a marketing gimmick to drive you to a higher model like the 6300 or 6400.  I was hoping to sign up for Amazon Prime, but since I was fooled, I don't think I will.  Of course, you can just buy a Roku.  Seems weird that Skype is included (if I buy a $$$ Samsung usb camera) but Yahoo! Widgets are not.2.  Picture clarity is superb - for HD content.  If you have 480p or 480i, you may not be as impressed.  Since my Apple TV is upscaling for most of my content, it's not a problem.  However, I also use the antenna, the 'retro' channels are a little rough, may start watching them at reduced size.3.  Remote and apps are pretty clunky.  For example, my old Sony had a 'punch thru' on the channel selector.  No matter what input I was watching, hitting the channel indexer immediately put me in antenna mode, a nice feature.  Maybe the Samsung remote is configurable, but you have to hit a few buttons to move around and traverse most of the remote to get there.4.  Still fiddling with settings, wish I could define settings for specific TV channels and not just an input.But I still give it 4 stars for picture and value.

Reviews.Title: Just A Warning...
Reviews.Author: Jordan Meiners "Jordan"
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to warn potential consumers of this tv is that it will not work with a HDMI cable longer than 20 feet.  Unfortunately, Samsung will not admit to this flaw.  It is a very rare occurence, but there are some televisions from all major brands that will not work with long hdmi cords.  This just happens to be one of them.Amazon has been wonderful (as usual) with this situation.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Tara K. "-Tara"
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm very happy with this TV. This is my first big screen LCD/LED model. It has great picture and sound. The only thing I notice is a sl ... (View Full Review)ight lag in picture when I compare it to my 42" plasma. I tried to enter the big screen LCD market 5-6 years ago and the lag was horrendous. The technology has improved greatly, but in this size, it's still not as good as a plasma. That said, it's not greatly noticeable and I do like this TV.I choose the 'D' series over the 'C' because it was web enabled for netflix streaming, etc. And, I went with the '6000' series because I didn't need 3D, full web browser or built in WIFI. This is a great TV for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Warning -- Possibly bad product -- Vertical lines appear on panel after 6 months
Reviews.Author: Mark Bookworth "MB"
Reviews.Content: I bought this LED TV panel in May, 2011.  It has worked well (nicely) until this week (Early December, 2011) when it began displaying translucent vertical lines over all source images. This makes the TV unwatchable.  It is possible to see the image (via HDMI from XBox, Bluray, WDTV) behind the vertical lines, but the lines blur the image badly.  When the TV is first powered on, it looks like there are two images of all the menu items stacked on one another, one being displaced by a couple of pixels from the other.I have yet to get in touch with Samsung but I am a long way from any repair shop so this is a major frustration.Very disappointed in Samsung.If I get it fixed, I will update this review.Update:-------After trying several input sources, resetting to factory default settings, adjusting the picture in every way imaginable, the TV still displays these lines which ruin the picture completely.I have contacted Samsung's cordial customer service and Amazon (also cordial).  Samsung is prepared to repair it but this helps little given how far from a service shop I am.  More important to me is to ensure those like me who might need a trouble free product for several years and cannot easily return it do not make the mistake I did in buying this product.  In my view, as good as a warranty may be and as helpful as customer service may be, if quality control is deficient, the whole experience becomes sour and ends up costing a lot of time and money to put right.  Manufacturers should produce products which LAST.I have searched the web for similar stories and there are many of them.  Apparently the problem results from inferior quality capacitors on these thin panels.  They can be repaired "at home" with a soldering iron but I am sure most would not wish to attempt such a technical repair.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Product - GREAT Value
Reviews.Author: njw
Reviews.Content: I'd had my 62 inch Mitsubishi DLP for almost 6 years.  The Mitsubishi was (and is still) a great tv.  But the "rear projection/DLP" technology is nowhere near the sharpness & brightness of an LED.  That said, as "Black Friday" neared this past November I began shopping for deals on LED hdtv's.  Every sales person I talked to said basically the same thing: "There are numerous great deals out there.  But, if you want the best, go with a Samsung."  So, I searched the web and found the Samsung UN60D6000 for an incredible "black Friday" price.  I snatched it up. It's been almost two months and I'm as blown away now as I was when I took it out of the box.  The picture is so life-like it feels like you can reach into the screen.  I had no interest in all the "extras" (apps, web browsing, 3D, etc).  All I wanted was a great hdtv at a great price.  The picture is bright at any time of day.  We have two skylights in our tv room and it doesn't effect the picture at all.  And the tv is unbelievably thin. I read a lot of negative reviews on flat-screen hdtv speakers.  I do have a Sony surround-sound system.  But, the Samsung built-in speakers are very sufficient for those times when you don't wanna rattle the walls. GREAT hdtv. Couldn't be more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Samsung "Smart" TV is misleading
Reviews.Author: J.M. "JM"
Reviews.Content: TV picture is fine, setup was easy.  Integration with other devices like my Denon 1912 is somewhat confusing, as which remote controls which feature when is not always clear with the interaction between devices.Samsung is not entirely honest about what is a "smart" tv and their Samsung apps.  Now I'm finding that not all apps or features are available for their "Smart" TV's.  I just found out I can't stream my Amazon Prime videos directly to the TV, somewhat a waste of Prime and Samsung.  I could have stepped up to another Samsung or perhaps an LG or buy a 3rd party devices, who knew?I'm not sure where you can get a list of the specific apps available for each model of TV, and I researched for a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture...but must perfect the proper settings
Reviews.Author: Adam Kloza
Reviews.Content: I researched a lot of TV's over the past 6 months and actually had my eye on another Samsung model...but got this one for $1,497 around Black Friday on Amazon.  The price drop was too good to pass up and I didn't have too much interest in 3-D (yet).  I purchased a $30 wi-fi dongle and boom...I basically had the same TV as the Samsung D6400 (minus 3-D) series for about $500 less on price.PICTURE:  Amazing...but you have to get your settings spot on to achieve this.  You can find good information on the AVS Forum....it takes a lot of reading and poking around, but it's worth it if you want your TV to shine at its best.  I watched an NBA game on X-mas day and it was truly amazing!SMART TV APPS:  Haven't used them a ton yet, but they were pretty slow the first few times I used them.  I like using the ESPN app and leaving all the score updates on my screen while I watch other games.  Others say that Netflix works pretty well, too.CONS:  Some flashlighting.  Nothing that can be done about it.  You can minimize it so that it isn't too bad(again...research your proper settings), but some flashlighting will always be present on these TV's...that's what edge lit LED's are all about.  If you continue to stare at the flashlighting during black or dark scenes...it will bother you.  But I just ignore it and enjoy the excellent picture on the TV the other 99% of the time.  I have slight flashlighting in all 4 corners of my tv...and so do most other people who buy this TV.  It's not a big deal unless you are a huge TV snob.So, overall, I give this 4 out of 5 stars.  The flashlighting and slow apps keep it from getting 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Trust me, I researched...
Reviews.Author: bpsixstrng
Reviews.Content: I researched for months for the exact TV I was going to get for my budget etc, and this is what it came to.Even if my budget were higher, I still would've picked this TV just in a bigger size.The picture is awesome (Samsung is the best out there in my opinion).There are plenty of inputs.The set up is easy.The angles are great. I can sit almost directly beside the TV and still see the image clearly.The only down side (if you can call it that) is that the audio is shaky at higher volumes. But lets be real... the physics of stuffing a 10W speaker into a 1.75 inch box... what can you expect. Accept the fact that you'll probably need to spend some money on a speaker system, and you'll be fine. I for one am looking into the sound bars for my set up.Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Incredible TV
Reviews.Author: Lono
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to grab this on Black Friday. Got the 60". Picture looked great out of the box but I did some additional research in techie TV forums and came across an expert calibration that had been hometheater for the 6000 model. Performed the changes yesterday and the picture went from great to absolutely amazing. Key bit is to use Movie mode. Go to hometheater on the web and search on UN46D6000 for the calibration details. Takes 5-10 minutes and it will blow you away. Btw, I have not noticed any flashlighting on my set.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M. Dillon "jvlp"
Reviews.Content: I am a video compression engineer for a major technology company. This does not mean I install home theaters, or cable in customers homes. I assess how to best maximize video picture quality for transmission. Picture quality is paramount. I have no interest in 3D or silly features. After a little tweaking the picture was amazing. Televisions are shipped to be displayed in brightly lit showrooms. This means the reds are too high, and whites too bright. The Samsung 6000 series TV rivals professional video monitors with picture quality.The only gripe I have the HDMI inputs will not pass Dolby Digital through the optical output.

Reviews.Title: Read if you don't care about pointless apps and like games.
Reviews.Author: Tom Berenger
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of people complaining about the lack of wireless capability and difficulty with obscure applications. If you are one of these, move on. If you are more interested in how this TV performs for games and movies, preyathee read on.First off, know that this TV has the incredible color, clarity, and brightness that you will only find in an LED TV. Even the the main menu in Xbox Live looks sweet. Things move with a smoothness you didn't even realise you were missing. The brightness and colour are almost obnoxiously awesome.I bought this TV also to replace my 26" PC monitor. After updating my Nvidia's driver and adjusting the sharpness (+ other settings), I was able to get the picture nearly as good as the monitor's, but brighter and more colourful. Games and video are better looking than on the monitor, however webpages have a slightly less natural look. Overall, great.Note, despite what the reviewer below stated, the optical output does throw 5.1, not just stereo. I use a Harmon Kardon receiver for all sound so I have not heard the built-in speakersA huge plus about this unit is the option to adjust or even disable the Auto Motion Plus. This is a huge benefit if you don't like the soap opera look but prefer a more classic film speed.My only two complaints are that you can't name inputs and the TV gives off enough heat to cozy up a studio apartment.Overall, and again, you probably can't find a better gaming/movie/PC TV out there for the price. Perfect for you if you don't care about connectivity, apps or on board speakers.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: Riss
Reviews.Content: This TV is excellent!Using the All Connect plugin in association with tvmobili I'm easily able to stream a large variety of video/picture/music contact from both my Windows and Mac computers.  The Samsung WIS09ABGN LinkStick Wireless LAN Adapter is a must have accessory for anyone wanting to explore the multimedia functions.  Setup was easy and performance has been excellent with no connectivity problems.The picture quality has been well above what I expected.  Blacks are black, not simply dark or faded.  Colors pop, with no distortion.  The additional settings from contrast to preset settings like "game" or "movie" mean that the performance is there no matter how I'm using the TV.The sound is excellent.  It easily fills the room with an extended range should I ever really decide to go all out.  While it has setup for external sound systems, I find that the TV itself has above average quality with nice definition which makes an external audio setup completely unnecessary.At this price, the quality is above anything I expected and I would absolutely recommend this TV to anyone looking for a mid-size option.

Reviews.Title: High quality TV
Reviews.Author: M. K. Lock
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV after a lot of research. There are a number of alternatives in the 32" class and I was drawn to this TV because of Samsung's good reputation and the high quality construction.The TV was for the lounge in my new apartment. I wanted a high quality picture, a slim design and a set big enough to give a great viewing experience, but not so big as to dominate the space.When it arrived I found set up to be a breeze. It took less than 5 minutes and I made only minimal adjustments to settings; the picture is that good out of the box. The set looks great and real premium quality. After living with it for a week I decided that it was actually too small and that I could easily go up to a 37" or 40" set, so I sent it back to Amazon with no fuss. I ordered an LG 37" replacement that turned out to be a nightmare (VA panels, extreme clouding, poor sound) and finally settled on a Samsung UN40D6000 (the big brother of this set) that is really amazing and the set I should have ordered 1st time around.

Reviews.Title: What A TV
Reviews.Author: D. Perkins
Reviews.Content: Samsung has produced a great LED LCD TV.  The slim design slipped easily into the limited space I have.  Very easy to connect all the accessories, cable box, DVR, and sound amp.  Out of the box to up and running less than half hour.  Turned it on and was wowed by the picture (digital) with no further adjustments needed.  Then got a HD cable box and was simply blown away.  I have not taken advantage of the WiFi feature but hope to soon.The only negative is the remote control which is not programable for non-Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: 55" Samsung LED
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: This smart TV is exactly what we wanted.  It is not 3D, but it is LED and is easy to connect to the internet.  Picture quality is exceptional even when not on an HD channel.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture, perfect sound
Reviews.Author: Vin
Reviews.Content: I now own this TV for 2 weeks. I was a lil sceptical at first. Reading various reviews and how manufactures sometimes put in cheap panels etc and the sound quality for LED. To my surprise, its all good and much much better that written in reviews. The picture quality is just awesome and the sound fills up a 14X16 room easily at 30% of the max volume. The Smart hub is also good and I have been playing You Tube and Netflix till date and it works just perfectly fine.One suggestion to the manufactures is to come up wiht a QWERTY keyboard kind of remote, it will make life much easier with the smart hub when u need to search items on You tube or VUDU.My suggestion Go for it!

Reviews.Title: Great picture. Terrible sound. Smarthub useless.
Reviews.Author: David Christopher
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Picture quality is superb. Sound quality is intolerable. But the most disappointing is the not so Smart Hub. Video streaming frequently breaks up or loses connectivity. My cheap Roku or my Wii gaming system do much better with video streaming. And ironically, you can't stream Amazon Prime VOD on it.Buy it for the picture quality. Use your home sound system for sound. Use another source for video streaming. You're basically buying a monitor.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Sat
Reviews.Content: In general Samsung TVs, there is a big problem with a Capacitor of TV which means after certain time usage of TV, Your TV takes a much longer time to turn it on and it starts getting worse. Samsung don't response to this problem unless you call them.In future if you have this kind of problem don't try to get repaired yourself and if you do, Samsung would not reimburse you for this repair.

Reviews.Title: Do your research before buying this Samsung tv
Reviews.Author: nycjm
Reviews.Content: Make sure you do your research before buying this tv. In particular, referring to the 120Hz vs. 60Hz.This is my first flat screen and I was misinformed re/what this feature is for. Basically if you are not watching 'action' sports you will not use this feature at all-you will TURN IT OFF! So, why are you paying all this extra money? In fact if you turn it on for regular tv viewing, it creates blur! So, depending on what else you want (apps, web, etc) you don't need this feature, which jacks up the price quite a bit.PROSBeautiful picture, nice colorsMenus user friendlyStand is sturdy, attractive modelCONSSound is unacceptable, sounds like a tin box, and mine hisses on the "s" when people are speaking. For $800, this is outrageous. I don't want booming surround sound and don't want to hook up to my stereo, and expected a better quality speaker. Samsung needs a better solution for a high end tv like this. SOUND IS IMPORTANT!!Haven't used any of the 'smart' features, so can't comment. I am exchanging the tv for a 60hz model LCD and hoping the speaker will be a little better.Last note: The tv is not holding its settings, reset 3x already, also after one week already has a firmware upgrade that has to be mailed to you...and I still have some blur even with AutoMotionPlus off. Not sure what is going on.

Reviews.Title: Green Lines and Green Dots
Reviews.Author: DF "DF"
Reviews.Content: We bought it on November 25th, 2011 from BestBuy. The good thing was that we also bought an extended BestBuy warranty.After about 8 months we noticed a vertical green line on the right side of the screen. We called BestBuy and a technician came to take a look. His recommendation was to replace the panel. So they did. The new panel lasted exactly 36 hours, and a new green line appeared. The panel was replaced for the second time. In about 2 weeks we noticed a green dot almost in the middle of the screen. We called BestBuy and they recommended to return this TV.The TV itself has great picture and I would not mind keeping it. But it looks like the panels have technical flows.

Reviews.Title: Superb not-that-smart TV!
Reviews.Author: Amazoncitizen1
Reviews.Content: After two weeks of doing research and countless visits to "brick-and-mortar" retailers, I decided to purchase this model. This is the type of TV that your eyes are drawn to even when comparing it with dozens of other models.PROS:- Superb video quality at 1080p.- Super slim; perfect to be mounted on a wall.- Internet capable, which means you can use your smartphone as a remote (iPhone at least).- Anynet+ allows you to control a compatible receiver like the Onkyo TX-NR509 5.1 Channel Network A/V Receiver. You can control volume, inputs, and even turn it on/off with just connecting a HDMI cable.CONS:- As other reviewers have mentioned, you can see some light bleeding on the corners in dark scenes when you have a dark room. Although I could say that bleeding is substantial on mine, it doesn't bother me enough to have it replaced. In fact, most people will never notice it unless you mention it.- The "Smart" part of the TV (SmartHub) is not smart at all. Apps take forever to load, the system freezes constantly, and even scrolling through apps seems slow and buggy. If you are looking to buy this model for the Smart function, I would recommend you to reconsider. Don't get me wrong, SmartHub is not completely useless, it is just very painful to use. I really don't use it that much as I use an Apple TV and a PlayStation 3 for streaming, apps, etc.Conclusion: As of the time of this review, it is really hard to find a "better" TV for this price. Although it has some drawback, I am very satisfied with my purchase. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: markp_13
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV over the 2011 Black Friday week from Amazon in November.  After several months of use, and tweaking the settings, I'm very happy with this TV.At first, the TV had one issue that bothered me quite a bit.  When watching normal TV, it seemed that the picture would judder...and this was not during fast action scenes or anything like that.  This was during sit-coms when a person was just moving around.  So I played around with the Motion settings and just couldn't seem to get rid of it.  It was getting to the point that I was about to return it.  Thankfully, since I bought it during a holiday season, the return policy was lengthened so I had an extra month to assess the TV and play around with it a bit more.After a bit of research, I found another setting on the TV that I had not changed during my trials.  It's the "Game Mode".  Basically when you turn Game Mode ON, all of the "intelligence" of the TV is turned OFF.  So the TV displays only the signal that's coming in without any intervention.  It doesn't do anything for motion blur, etc...Now with the Game Mode set to ON, I have no issues while watching any kind of programming.  So I'm glad I kept the TV.I got the 60" which is quite large but fits nicely in my family room which is 16x20 (TV is on the long wall...)  I mounted it above my fireplace and it looks great.  It's very thin and the border is small and unobtrusive.  Also I like that all of the connections are on the same plane as the TV so you can get the TV pretty tight to the wall without smashing and bending the cables.Sound quality out of the speakers is quite good for normal programming.  But if you're going to watch a movie, best to use a surround sound system.Overall I like the TV and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: generalinq
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV on boxing day when it was on sale.  Also ordered the samsung ultra slim mount to compliment it.Picture Quality:  Amazing.  Looks sort of 3D.  The auto motion plus does jitter once in a while but hardly enough to really take your attention away from what you are watching.  Sometimes doesn't happen at all.  Can be turned off or changed to another settings to minimize or remote it jitter.  The auto motion plus gives sort of like a home movie effect.  Some people like it, others do not.  I am used to it and love it.  I think it makes movies look so much more realistic. Especially disney movies with the kids.The clouding effect people talk about is also so hardly noticable.  I almost did not buy this TV because of those reviews but everyone I ask has no idea what I'm talking about when I ask them if they notice that.  There is a VERY VERY slight light from the corner of the screen but only 1 corner and it's not distracting at all.  I'm telling you, hardly hardly noticable.Buy this thing.  You won't regret it for the price.

Reviews.Title: not so smart
Reviews.Author: Jessica Cassidy "Jessica C"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a TV in over 7 years. I bought this one to watch streaming movies from Hulu and Amazon Instant Video.The picture looks good to me.Samsung Smart TV is not worth it. Get the version without Smart TV Samsung LN40D630 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV (Black) and hook it up to a Home Theater PC. Control it with a bluetooth keyboard like FAVI Entertainment Wireless Keyboard (Built-in TouchPad/Laser Pointer) - Black.1. Wireless networking requires a Samsung specific USB adapterSamsung WIS09ABGN WIRELESS LINKSTICK WIS09ABGN2 USB LAN Adapter FOR SAMSUNG 2009 - 2010 & 2011 BLU-RAY PLAYERS, 2010 & 2011 SAMSUNG TVs. It costs at least 5x more than it should. It does not support the 5Ghz band for 802.11n. Many people complain about it and use a wireless bridge instead.2. There is no app to watch Amazon Instant Video. They have been saying they are working on it for a year. There is no promised delivery date.3. Searching is clunky with the on screen keyboard. You can't use an external keyboard. The Android remote only lets you enter text in one global search app. That search app does not search Netflix.4. The Smart TV interface is extremely slow. I frequently have to wait a few seconds for the cursor to move. I always have to wait much longer for any apps to load.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV!
Reviews.Author: JoeD
Reviews.Content: First off, it is important to note that I have only had this television a very short period of time so please do not take this review as any sort of proponent of its long-gevity, or performance in a high use, long time frame.I love that this Television is under $1000, a Samsung, and a Smart TV.  It is 3D ready, but 3D is just a gimmick that is not going to catch any sort of mass use fire in my opinion, so this option was not important to me.I used to be an audio and videophile as a hobby until children came along.  We re-purposed my theatre room for a more family-friendly room where the kids can have their toys and play space as well.  This meant a new television since my previous one in that room was a big and boxy rear projection which took up too much space although for 8 years old was still on top of its game.Enter this Samsung TV!  I already own a Samsung 32" LCD TV for another room in our house and love it, so going with Samsung again was a no-brainer for me.  I weighed the pros and cons of LCD vs. LED and figured that LED does have more benefits of LCD, but comes at a heftier price.  However this Samsung TV was on sale when I bought it. Not sure if this means Samsung has a model to replace it or not.The picture is fantastic!  I was able to spend some time fine dialing in the picture to THX specs.  (This is not something 95% of people do).  If this is something you will do, it will take considerably longer since one of the cons of this television is that you have to adjust the video and audio settings per each component port... not a blanketed setting for the entire TV no matter what component is selected.Another Con is that Samsung by default turns on this feature that has to do with Fast Motion called "Auto Motion Plus".  It seems like a great idea and it really wows you at first at how the screen blows any other TV out of the water because it is so darn crystal clear with movements and such.  However, this also causes "jitteryness" and "choppyness".  Its almost as if the built in technology can't keep up... sort of like a computer that's processing too much so your mouse is jittery on the screen.  Once I turned this off all was fine.  This should be turned off anyway since the video feeds should never be altered by a secondary source to try and enhance them.As far as the "Smart TV" technology goes... I like it, but its interface on the TV is not very easy to figure out.  Let's face it, we live in an iApple generation and we have gotten so used to the simple, easy to use and figure out interfaces of our devices.  The Samsung Smart TV interface falls a little short of that.  I connected it to my home network via ethernet cable since it has a built in ethernet port no problem and was online with it in seconds.  We have been enjoying the Netflix app on it, and it seems to come with a ton of other apps for music, social networking etc... all of which we will not use so I cannot speak to how well they work.  If you want to use the Smart TV feature with your wireless network, you will have to purchase the USB Samsung WiFi adapter separately.All in all, we love this Television!  It displays our Satellite service beautifully!  We still have an old school Progressive scan DVD player since the only DVD's we have and buy are for kids.  That DVD player is connected to the component port and displays just fine too.  The television is thin giving it a cool sleek look.  For an LED TV under $1000 you can't beat it unless you want to get the popular "V" TV that skimps on granularity of picture settings and is made with very cheap hardware.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV... Smart HUB is worth it but it is really slow - Not Amazon Prime compatible
Reviews.Author: H. Al-Harethi
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV around Black Friday and it paid almost half of what I paid to an LCD I have purchased 3 years ago. It is amazing how prices on these TVs go down.The 6000 series is the lowest you should go ( which really has more than what I really want as I don't care about 3D now). Why? Because it is lowest series which include Samsung Apps which is basically the Smart HUB.For those who don't know, Samsung Apps is just freaking awesome. It allows you to watch Youtube or use other video applications. It has social plugins and better than ever, it allows you to play Videos from your external Hard Disk Drive or AllShare computer on your network. It allows you to also use Samsung iPhone app to control the TV as long as they're both connected to the same Access Point ( or basically same network/router ).Again, the awesomeness comes if you have HiDef media on your HDD like MKV movies. It has crazy engine to play 1080p movies with no hassle.Cons:- The remote is not really that responsive. I set about 4 feet away and it does not respond quickly like my 2010 Samsung 55 inch LED HDTV does.- Smart HUB is always checking/installing updates almost every time I use it. It also takes some time to process the content of the HDD to show you what you have.- I have Amazon Prime and it disappoints me that this TV and its series are not Prime-friendly. How come Samsung?- I still don't get the 120Hz to work, anything I play says it plays it in 60Hz.... what the heck? Anyone knows how does this really work or do I really need it?Finally, the TV is really beyond beautiful and it is worth every penny. Don't go for higher series like D6300 because it adds nothing but a web browser. If you don't care about 3D or built-in wireless and have your home networked like mine or have an extra port on your router available, I would not go for a higher series.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Television
Reviews.Author: D_Sone "Sone"
Reviews.Content: I was originally seeking to get the 40" LED version, but settled on this size because I wanted something that could fit nicely onto my bookcase. I have to say I am very pleased with this set and it is plenty big enough for where I have it.Installation instructions were clear and installation was simple and quick. Only tool needed to attach the supplied stand was a screwdriver. The supplied stand is well made, wide, and heavy. The screen doesn't wobble once affixed.After a few set-up menus (use settings, time/date, etc.) the TV is ready to go. This was great as I was excited to start playing my PS3 on it right away.The great things is that the default brightness -- for home use -- was nearly perfect for playing video games. Often at the stores, they put the sets too bright and contrasty as a sales tactic. So, don't be surprised if the settings appropriate for you aren't as bright as you saw in a store.The colors, dynamic range, contrast, and 120Hz refresh rate is excellent for today's HD movies, sports, and fast-paced gaming. There is a visible difference between 720p and 1080p as well as the 60Hz and 120Hz. The higher resolution will give you sharper, more detailed images and the faster refresh rates reduce or eliminate ghosting. Of course, to take full advantage of all these features, you'll need your inputs to be HD and via an HDMI cable.The speakers provide good sound, but it is not rich-sounding due to the very small woofers. But you can't expect great sound from such small speakers.Thankfully, there are a ton of ports on this set to satisfy your entertainment needs. At first I didn't like the side-mounted ports, but since this unit can be mounted nearly flush with the wall, I got over it.I like the use of LEDs because it uses less electricity, reaches full brightness faster, and still provides great contrast.CONS:I would have liked them to include an HDMI cable.Screen is semi-glossy, making it prone to glare and reflections.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Gardenwitch
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous TV, super picture.  Set up was super easy and stand is not only good looking, but solid.  Nice feature is that the TV swivels for easy access to the back and input ports.  Excellent value and Amazon Prime delivered flawlessly.

Reviews.Author: pacia
Reviews.Content: Pros:- great picture- price- love the apps (blockbuster, youtube,..)- works great with ps3- super thin display- amazon delivery: very nice and on time full service with installation includedcons:- lack of component cable input.  They provide you with a very cheap adapter that does not work.  The adapter is so cheap that can sustain the weight of the cables.  Picture comes out horrible with colored messed up and a lot of interference. If you need a component input, don't buy this tv- remote:  it would better if they include a qwerty keyboard which is necessary for the appsa note on AutoMotion plus: this looks like a very nice feature to watch sport, but I had to turn it off for movies.  This feature create a weird effect to movies, that turn into some sort of home made hd movie....hard to explain  but way too weird

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: AmazonFan.RichVA
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a 2 yr old+ 40 in Samsung which was a fine TV (sold it to my son). This new TV does have a better, crisper, brighter picture. Also better sound (I would rate sound as 'Excellent' but may because old TV sound was poor). Out of the box, the "soap opera affect" was pronounced and very distracting. TURN OFF "Auto Motion Plus"! I have found no circumstance where Auto Motion Plus makes anything better. Don't try watching football or tennis with it turned on! (Find under Picture/Picture Options). I like "Standard" Picture Mode, ("Movie" mode sometimes esp. older movies in SD). The screen also has a lot of glare and reflects like a mirror any light on in the room. My old TV had a matte screen and reflections weren't a problem. I bought this TV because of Samsung reputation, good experience with my old Samsung and the favorable customer reviews. I haven't found the orgasmic epiphany in TV viewing that some reviews report. Probably because I was coming from another Samsung. A very good TV especially for the sub- $1,000 price. I would buy again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32 LED-TV 1080p 120Hz
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: This image of the Samsung TV is absolutely amazing. It was exactly what I was looking for. It is a great size, because I move a lot, making it easy to transport in a car and is extremely light weight. The Box and the Styrofoam guards were completely destroyed upon arrival to my house, but the TV was still perfectly intact. It has HDMI making it easy to connect both Xbox360 and PS3 easy. I was conflicted between getting the 60hz and 120hz, but the 120hz makes all the difference in my opinion. Excellent TV overall.

Reviews.Title: I don't miss the larger TV

Reviews.Content: Great tv  Even though I have had it only a couple weeks. It has a great picture.Have not had any problems with it but it will take a while to figure out the remote. Looks good on my wall

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I must admit that this wasn't my most well-researched purchase; I spent about 2 minutes on Amazon looking for an LED TV and this one fit the budget (I paid $770) so I decided to get it. And it is the best (and most expensive) least-informed purchase I've ever made.Right out of the box, the TV looks fantastic. The bezel is 1.25" on the sides and 1.5" on the top and bottom. The TV itself is very thin (just over 1") and can be wall-mounted or put on a stand (included). The stand itself looks very sharp and does the TV justice.The picture quality is very good. Movies look fantastic; my Blu-rays can finally shine in all their 1080p glory. A note about movies: a lot of reviews comment on the "smoothness" or the "soap opera look" when watching movies. This effect can be mitigated by turning off Auto Motion Plus (it's turned on by default). However, even with Auto Motion Plus (which is Samsung's fancy name for frame interpolation) turned off, you can still see a bit of that smoothness, but it's not as pronounced. I highly recommend visiting a local TV store and seeing for yourself how movies look on 120Hz TVs (be sure to ask the sales rep to turn off frame interpolation).Gaming is fantastic on the TV. I'm using a PS3 connected via HDMI, and once you enable game mode, the input lag is nonexistent. This is a huge deal for me as my previous TV (a 5 year old Samsung DLP) had horrendous input lag even with game mode enabled.The sound, on the other hand, is not that great. It lacks bass (as expected) and sounds tinny. I ended up buying speakers for it, and if this is going to be your main TV, I suggest you do, too.I have not used any online apps so I can't comment on them. Note that you'll need to buy a separate wifi dongle if you don't fancy the idea of using an ethernet cable.What I love about the TV is that it can play videos that you store on an external hard drive (including mkv). This feature is what pushed the TV from 4 stars to 5.Overall, if you're looking to buy a solid HDTV without breaking the bank, this is a fantastic buy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the $
Reviews.Author: Matthew N. Tawes "MNTawes"
Reviews.Content: Having owned the TV and enjoyed it thoroughly for about 2 months I must say that its a very nice TV for the $. I shopped and compared many models and side by side the Samsung quality could not be matched. The apps feature is sub par as there are few useful ones and the only 2 that I tend to use are Netflix,Pandora and of course the smart features of being able to access my external drive directly for music and video are nice. The number one feature that should be on this set is an internet browser since 50% of the TV I watch is streaming TV shows that I miss (and are not available through Netflix, or Hulu). Nonetheless there are no shortage of HDMI ports so I hook up to the laptop to stream browser content since Samsng felt that an internet connected TV need not have a browser to actually consume internet content (they felt child's cartoon apps were more useful).The speakers are okay if sitting close and have a small room but fall short of true surround or good sound quality so I'm using a Yamaha home theater system to solve that.All in all I'm very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Author: joe nonose "mac dre"
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a vizio 720p lcd and this blows that out of the water obviously. Once you get everything set up all the picture settings and whatnot to your liking this thing looks amazing, Now the picture is not perfect though but still one of the best looking tv's in its class, the auto motion plus is a nice feature, alot of people dont like the soap opera filter look, i kind of do however have found that with this feature on makes the picture more smooth but also makes some type of pixelation in fast scenes which i cant really explain without seeing in person but with it off makes it look less smooth but takes away this problem i described so my best setting would be custom blur reduction to 10 and judder to 5 seemed to be the best setting for me anyway, overall a very good tv. I give it a 8/10
