Reviews.Author: Boxiebunny
Reviews.Content: I have only had this TV for a short time but have already found the apps to be addictive.  The size is perfect for a small livingroom.  The picture is excellent with the digital format.  Although I am not particularly literate in modern technology, I have not yet had to consult the instruction manual on the use of the applications, even facebook.  It is noted that the ability to use wireless does not come with this particular screen size; however, it can be ordered separately.  One wish - if one wants to use facebook, the remote is more of a traditional one, so using that to send messages is very tedious.Samsung UN32D6000 32-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Lack of S-PVA panel aside, it is a good performer
Reviews.Author: Twiddles42
Reviews.Content: I started TV-hunting to replace a Sony KDL-32S3000 set (720P, CCFL-backlit).Without namedropping, I can say that this set - without any gimmicks like adding a yellow subpixel - does a good job at display.  Colors are vibrant, blacks are solid, and shadow detail is great for a LED-backlit monitor, apart from a caveat...Once calibrated, color gamut and shadow detail are above average for a LED-backlit LCD monitor.  Indeed, the panel technology used (VA) allows for deeper blacks compared to IPS (which has better shadow detail and color gamut.)Light bleed is a minor issue.  This is normal for LCD panels, regardless of backlighting type.  This set performs better than competing models I've gawked at, but the manufacturing process, even at the best of times, can't catch every unit passing through their QC channel.Clouding (white splotches/circles) is also a minor issue.  Especially compared to the previous LED-backlit set I viewed, the one with the yellow subpixel...Blacks are very deep.Shadow detail looks very good, though some darker grays/near-blacks have a slightly blue tinge (but not bad), and there isn't much in the way of "black crush" - which is a problem common in all LCD monitors where darker grays and shadow detail are presented as being completely black.  Especially compared to other brands and models that are 40", this Samsung does a VERY good job with shadow detail and color gamut.  I've seen better, but my review is an amalgamation of good and bad aspects and when all is said and done, I like this TV set a lot.And shadow detail does seem above average, as it's clear the set is using a VA panel rather than IPS... But I was hoping Samsung used its own S-PVA panel technology, but that is not to be.  While the set's quality is otherwise VERY high, the unit I purchased has a very poor viewing angle and colors get washed out from surprisingly slim angles.  Had Samsung used their own S-PVA panel technology in their own models, and S-PVA is far superior to the other VA panel types I've read about, I'd give this set 5 stars with absolute ease.  Unless Samsung is ashamed of using their own technology, of course...One workaround is to raise the brightness setting a couple notches above calibration, even if it does mean reducing black levels, but would be on par with my old Sony.  So, ultimately, it's give-or-take and, either way, it's passable.[...]One picture.  One thousand words.  But proof Samsung does make a competing panel technology and it is not being used in this model.  Hence my disappointment.  I just don't know why they wouldn't use their own technology in all of their own TV sets.My only other gripe is the lack of native composite and component inputs.  Two adapter cables (one for each type) are included, complete with disclaimer that actually reads this:CAUTIONINSERT SECURELYLEST SHOULD BEDETACHED IN SETNow, if you look at these adapter cables, they are solidly made - and given how the plug-ins on the set are devised, there is nothing that COULD get detached into the set. And if you don't plug them in securely, they'll fall out.  Not sure what they mean...  still, after a few centuries, it really is nice reading the word "lest" again...Having said all that, this is NOT a bad set.  It could just be better, especially for the retail price.  But, as far as LED-backlit sets go, this is above-average and the other brand I used, which sold for the same price, is a far poorer model despite the extra pixel gimmick.Best of all, in 5 years' time, what will replace the D6000 will probably be rock-solid in concept, design, and execution.Addendum:  10/07/2011:Overall, this is a great set, worthy of the 4-star rating, but it would be wrong not to mention this update.  I still recommend this set for HD material only.  But this set has problems displaying standard-def material.  "The Simpsons" and "Star Trek: The Next Generation" both prominently show juddering and interlacing problems while panning.  At first I thought it was the DVD player.  Multiple players, including a Blu-Ray device, all had the same problem.  Even setting the player from "auto" to "480i" did not fully rectify this problem.  Indeed, the player should be capable of seeing the DVD as standard broadcast material (480i).  And, at 480i, what will 1080P source material look like...I used only HDMI connections.  I tried another HDMI cable.  It is not the cable...  Enabling every smoothness setting had no effect.  The problem IS the set's integrated upconverter.  Maybe buying a $500 DVD set can compensate.  Nor should anybody have to; my 32" 720P TV set made in 2007 and costing as much as this 40" set should NOT be showing a smoother, crisper display.  I know upconverting will reveal limitations of source material, but fluidity should not be juttered, or in any other way affected.  My other LCD set does not struggle like this Samsung set does.)

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality!!! Great TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: Bookaholic
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV a couple of weeks back - and has ever since been patting my back for the right choice I made.Pros:This TV has amazing picture quality, is easy to set up, provides several options to connect to other devices (DVD players, cable boxes, Wii console etc.) and has decent internet connection capabilities.  There is no built-in wireless card - but that is no big deal as you can always run a wire from your router to the TV and perhaps a wired connection is faster and sturdier than a wireless one; so I do not consider it a con at all.Cons:AllShare (proprietary software to connect various compliant devices with the TV and vice versa) documentation in the user manual is sketchy - you may have to go online to learn more.  YouTube app sucks - every time you turn it on a non-family friendly video comes up; also, hard to search for videos; wish the remote made it a bit easier by having a keypad.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Continues To Improve upon the Best Picture
Reviews.Author: D. G. Lima
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the previous model of Samsung 40" LED TV, and found the UN40D6000 to have better picture quality and to be more responsive than the earlier model, which I replaced after  about eight years [the backlight had started to go]. The menu is better-organized, with more logically-grouped choices, and one can more-easily customize the picture to personal taste. When I set up my picture, I pick two stations to alternate back-and-forth: one sporting event, and [usually] an in-studio program, such as a news program, the one for outdoor skin tones, and grass/dirt tones, the other for indoor skin tones, and clothing. The sporting event is also good for adjusting sharpness, with the crowd shots--one can view just how sharp the picture needs to be by watching the crowd, while making the adjustments. Fast-motion adjustments can now be effected, as well, for those who are of a mind to do it. Adjustments can be made for clarity, when watching events that rush by quickly--say, for example auto races, ski-flying, or chase scenes.This model also now displays what type of signal is being received, so that when switching stations, and there is a lag time, you'll see, in the upper left-hand corner of the screen, a display advising that there is a change in the nature of the signal--thus creating the lag time.The Auto Motion Plus feature is an enhancement that hugely--though subtly--improves all motion--even in older movies--so that the motion appears much more lifelike and immediate than any television duplication I've seen previously. The blur around the edges of the moving characters is gone, and their motion is far more vivid. It has to be seen--it can't really be explained. I know of no other TV that accomplishes this.The first time I bought an HD LED TV, I went through the Consumer Reports studying and personal research for months, and settled firmly on Samsung as the brand of choice, and I have seen no reason to switch. Picture quality is the number one reason for purchasing a television, as far as I'm concerned, and Samsung still offers the best--to my eye--by far, but don't judge by the factory settings, they're not so great. You have to set it up yourself, to get it to your own personal taste, then you'll see...

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Ryan J. Pulliam
Reviews.Content: Just bought this 55-inch hdtv and I love it. Thin border, great quality screen, big, etc.I am not using the sound on the tv; I instead hooked up my BOSE iPod dock and it works awesome. I highly suggest it for anyone wanting a cheap sound system.I'm hoping to find out later that 3D can be added on.If anyone knows or hears any way 3D can be added to this model, please comment on this review;I'll be notified of your comment.

Reviews.Title: Samsung un55d6000
Reviews.Author: G. Schmotzer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV through amazon about a month ago. I read several previous reviews, and went to a store to look at it in person before purchasing. The transaction through amazon was smooth with no problems. This TV looks fantastic. The picture is so sharp and clear that I can see things on the shows that I watch that I could not see clearly before, and I was replacing a big screen HD TV that was only six years old. People have commented that it looks like you are really there where the camera is filming. When watching the local news, you can clearly see the eye color of the news casters. I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV all around.
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Like most reviewers here, I did a hell of a lot of research before buying a TV.  I went with this.The TV itself is beautiful.  Very slim and there's not too much extra.  Samsung knows how to design a TV.  The picture quality on this TV is outstanding.  I play PS3 on this almost as much as I watch TV and I notice absolutely no negative effects with this tv.  No ghosting or anything of the sort.  It's damn near perfect in every way.  Sound quality is outstanding as well.Other positives:  It's a Smart TV, so it has apps and connects to the internet.  For me the best ones are Netflix and Samsung's Allshare (DLNA Client).  Netflix goes without saying.  I download a lot of TV and Movies to my computer, and with Allshare, I can stream everything directly to my TV.  It's really a time saver and I can't imagine not having it.The cons that I would say are:1. Depending on your lighting situation, you can get some to a lot of glare.2. The flashlighting effect IS there.  BUT, I rarely notice it.  I usually notice it playing PS3 when an all black loading screen comes up, in the DARK.  Other than that, never.  If you turn your brightness up too much, it's more pronounced, but I would say that if that's the case, you haven't calibrated your set properly.3. Allshare doesn't support every codec.  I'm not sure if that's the TV's fault, or the protocol.  Either way, I just download everything as an .avi file and it works.  No biggie.  If I want better quality, I can use my PS3.4. Volume consistency.  I'd say this is more the fault of the inputs rather the TV, but I can be streaming something at volume 20, and then jump to my cable box and it's BLASTING, and I have to turn it down to 7.  I just wish the TV could normalize the volume.5. This is completely on Samsung, but they abandon their old TVs software wise.  Why the TV hasn't been given an Amazon Instant Streaming app is beyond me.  Many other software updates will never find it's way to this TV.  But that's their way of getting you to buy something new.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but watch out for the price
Reviews.Author: D. Lee
Reviews.Content: I love this TV and I use the SMART features all the time for Netflix, HBO GO and Pandora. However, I purchased it brand new mid-2011 from an Amazon marketplace supplier for about 15% less than the current listing price (18 months later).  Make sure you don't order this one, but instead, order the newer model, which is much less.

Reviews.Title: One year usage.
Reviews.Author: AFuey "fsl"
Reviews.Content: Excellent with awesome HD colors and depth TV with no problems.  I recommend this TV to everyone with a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: John Favorita
Reviews.Content: This TV has meet all of my expections for clarity and picture quality. I think because it is a smart TV(Internet Capably)  you should advise that you need th other controler with the Key board on the reverse side.

Reviews.Title: Clicking sound and wont turn on-"Samsung tv"
Reviews.Author: Mishylyn
Reviews.Content: This Samsung UN60D6000 60 inch tv was purchased recently, and has a manufacture date of November 2011. Yet it now wont turn on and has a clicking sound. Reviews.Title: Very poor quality or bad luck!
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel Ferry
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN60D6000 60-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black) [2011 MODEL]My happiness with this product only 8 months because suddenly the screen went blank and serves no more. Apparently the screen died for faulty. In reviewing the possibility of returning it expired I find the time to do. The truth is that never again would buy a TV so expensive this way. Really worth going to a store that offers security with a problem like this.

Reviews.Title: Broken Already?
Reviews.Author: Bryan Pendleton
Reviews.Content: We got a Samsung 46 inch 1080p 120Hz LED/ HDTV in November of 2011. On September 28 2012 it worked beautifully, sound & picture perfect. On September 29th 2012 we turned it on to get a fuzzy screen that faded to total blackness except for a small tubular shaped gray splotch on the lower right hand corner of the screen. Beautiful sound but no picture. We tried all the obvious trouble shooting things like check the wiring and plugs but found nothing to correct. We pulled out the various manuals and product information but didn't find anything useful. I called Samsung and low and behold I actually got a live body on the phone. Wow. I described the issue. She said "oh, yes, we will have to send a tech out" - clearly this was a familiar issue. She took down all the info and put in a service request with a local Samsung repair company. They called on Monday to say they would be out on 10/5 (today). I got a call today saying they'd ordered the part but that it hadn't arrived. Ordered the part? Without having seen it? Clearly this screen / panel issue is not only familiar but common! Possibly they will get the part and come out on 10/10. What a disappointment. We had our last tv for over 15 years.

Reviews.Title: main panel out
Reviews.Author: hb99664
Reviews.Content: Bought the 55 inch lcd SAMSUNG supposed to have 10,000 hrs or more time NOT main panel went out 3 months after warranty expired will not buy or recommend Samsung to anyone.

Reviews.Title: TV lasted only 8 months
Reviews.Author: practical29
Reviews.Content: The TV was great for 8 months.  Clear, crisp picture quality, bright vivid colors, great sound, etc.  Three days ago when I was watching, the picture flashed and turned dark blue-black.I can hear tv programs, change channels, but no picture.  There are a few light speckles showing on the screen in the corner.  I contacted Samsung immediately for an exchange and have yet to hear back from them, and Amazon does not deal with returns for such matters.  So now, I am stuck with an expensive tv that does not work.  I made the mistake of purchasing this TV from Amazon.  I will never do this again, because when something goes badly, they clearly state that it is not their responsibility.  My lesson, buy locally, where you can walk back into a store with your TV that is not working.  I cannot afford to buy a new TV and Amazon and Samsung is missing in action.

Reviews.Title: Half Screen Uncolored!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jose Lluberes
Reviews.Content: I bought this LED from Samsung because I have always trusted Samsung. They lost my trust in this one!!!! I bought it on September 2011 and started giving problems on March 2012 (conveniently for Amazon and Samsung, since its a 30 day money back), it started with a thin line of what seems to be dead pixels. Then, it got worst!!! Half of screen now flickers from great color to dim and shallow color. As if almost going into black and white but with a hint of color. Since I live in Dominican Republic I have no chance of returning (it passed 1 months anyway) but apart from that services for Samsung TV is very limited. I have no repair for my TV. I will have to stick with it, luckily the flickering stops for a while, maybe to once a week. but its totally not worth paying so much for something broken from the factory! DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL!

Reviews.Title: Was a great TV until the LCD died
Reviews.Author: rollerb
Reviews.Content: I loved this TV for the four months it worked. The display looked great, the features worked well, and it played well with the Samsung home theater system we bought. Unfortunately, while watching a movie one night, the LCD panel apparently went bad and started "ghosting" all the images.This is apparently a known issue with Samsung based on the problem selection list on their support site, and while they originally planned to come to my home and replace the LCD panel, they later said the part was unavailable, and I am still (2.5 weeks later) waiting for word on when they will be able to deliver the replacement (a more recent model, it appears.)This *was* a great TV, and I don't know if I just hit a bad one, or if there is a persistent problem with this model.I give Samsung mixed marks for support. I appreciate the option of in-home repair under the warranty and their willingness to replace it with a newer model, but this has dragged out longer than it needs to, and their support site is useless for tracking the ticket progress. All I get is a message about an invalid ticket number when I click on the link in the email they sent. I also get more complete information on the new TV (UN46ES6100) from Amazon's product page than I do from Samsung's site.

Reviews.Title: So good I bought two!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Hoherd
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these from Best Buy and it was so awesome (my first HDTV) that I bought one for my parents to replace their ancient CRT monstrosity.  They keep e-mailing me to tell me how they can see imperfections on the faces of allegedly beautiful people and how they can see new details like patterns on clothing and wallpaper in movies they've watched a million times.Truth be told, the "Smart" functions of this TV are pretty lame.  It's sad that they can't put a decent microprocessor in here to run their apps.  I'm sure that'll come in a future revision, but for now it sucks.  I mean... it takes like 15 seconds just to open up the Smart function... then once it's open it hangs there for another 15 seconds while it loads content... then when you select your app it takes another 15-30 seconds just to open the app.  If only this thing came with an autoexec.bat so I could tell it to RUN YOUTUBE.COM.  To fix this, I hooked up an Apple TV to it for all my Netflix / Youtube / Vimeo stuff, and it's much more responsive.  Also, I hooked up a computer for playing things like MKV!Speaking of movie formats, this TV is pretty good at handling USB drives and Windows 7 shared media like photos and videos from your user account.  Home videos look better on this TV than they do in real life!  I never even realized my wallpaper had patterns until I saw it on this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: Camarillo Brillo
Reviews.Content: We spent a long time deciding which TV to buy. We knew it was going to be Samsung, but the question of which model was tough because it seems like the 3D thing has really kicked in and brought the prices up. IMO, the world of 3D does not live up to expectations at this point, and after looking at all the different models up to the 8000, this one seemed to everything we needed without spending a fortune. Also helped that there was a fantastic early Black Friday deal.The picture is fantastic. The sound is fine for internal (we use a sound system with it for movies and games), the amount of ports and connections are perfect.Before buying, we read a lot of reviews about this and other TVs where people complained about the images skipping or having color issues (people complain about anything), but we've experienced NONE of this. Those people were all on forums dedicated to highest quality TV and they were complaining that this (relatively) inexpensive Samsung wasn't up to task that a 8000 model is... well, it's $2000 cheaper, so what do you expect? I would and have recommended this TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my husband who is an AV/ TECH guy by profession (very picky guy- says SUMSUNG is the top of the line ) ....told him one of my friends wanted to buy one for her husband (for advice) ...he was very happy when I got him his choice ! Note...my friend got one for her husband & he was very impressed! It was delivered on time....and in perfect condition...Jo

Reviews.Title: 55 in. Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Jerome M. Kuzma
Reviews.Content: The clarity and resolution of the picture is beyond any picture I saw on any of the 10 brands I compared to Samsung. In addition to the great picture, the price we paid at Amazon was $150 cheaper and no state sales tax was paid.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32D6000 LED some things not in previous reviews
Reviews.Author: Mikeintexas
Reviews.Content: PROS: Picture quality is great; Remote is easy to use with on/off illumination; Base stand is very sturdy; Pics,video,music,movies plays from usb flash drive(wi-fi if buy adapter).CONS: No hard copy manual(e-manual in tv); Took awhile to figure out how to program favorites(web site FAQ no help) then to figure out how to turn favorites on/off; No WARNING upfront about led screen. Do not touch screen it will leave a smuge from finger that will only get bigger if you try to clean it without special screenclean solution(BUY SCREENCLEAN KIT WITH TV) then it is like polishing.CONCLUSION: Definitely a BUY. Go ahead and buy screenclean kit with it and if you have kids get a wall mount and mount it out of reach.(there is a glass screen you can mount on front of tv,but i think that would cause a glare)UPDATE:8/17/12 Speakers are on bottom facing down and sound is hard to hear bouncing off table, may need sound bar or audio/video reciever to hear good.

Reviews.Title: Best TV on the Market
Reviews.Author: Wendy Hoffman
Reviews.Content: We shopped everywhere for a TV for my parents who just moved and bought a new house.  We have a 46-inch LCD Samsung which we bought years before and LOVE it.  This 60-inch LED Samsung is a fantastic TV.  The picture is incredible and the look is very sleek.  Samsung consistently has the best TV's on the market and this one is a perfect example of why.  LOVE this TV!

Reviews.Title: Great Product & Price
Reviews.Author: Romi
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN46D6000 is a total winner. Excellent picture and audio quality, features and ease of use. My research showed this was the TV to buy and the product live up to the expectations. The price on Amazon was great as well. Just an excellent product and purchase.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV with minor flaws
Reviews.Author: Throckmorton P. Ruddygore "Ruddy"
Reviews.Content: I was in the market finally for a large flat screen TV after my 27 inch Sony VEGA's picture started to go after 10+ years. I took a stroll over to the local blue box store to check out selections in person to get an idea of what was out there as this is the first time I've been in the market.My eyes were immediately drawn to the 55 inch Samsung. I wasn't planning on making a purchase until I saw the price - it was only $999. After talking to one of the store reps he checked and found that the actual sales price was $1500, but said I could get it for $999. It was on back order, so I figured I had nothing to lose. I could do my research and cancel the order if necessary. I checked out a lot of the reviews here and was mainly concerned with the "flash-lighting" and "clouding" mentioned by some reviewers.After having this set for over 2 months, I'm very very happy with my purchase. The flash-lighting and clouding do exist, but you only notice this when sitting in a very dark room. Even then, these issues were hardly noticeable. I know some reviewers have stated that it was a deal breaker and they returned the set. Not sure if this was because the flaws were worse on their sets or if price came into play. I think if I paid $2000 - $2500, I might have been a bit more upset and may have considered returning it. However, I tend to doubt it. The TV isn't perfect, but it has an awesome picture for the most part. The flash-lighting and clouding do exist to a point, but not so much that the average user is going to notice in most cases. Overall I'm very happy with the product - especially with the price which was pure luck.Update 8/2012 - Still love the tv and have received a lot of comments on the picture quality. Even today, the price I got last year is still a deal. I still don't have it hooked to the internet as I only have DSL which is a bit too slow to take care of web content that you can access through Smart Hub. I have started playing around with playing movie content in HD mp4 off an external hard drive which I've plugged directly into the USB port. I especially like this feature because I can rip all the kids movies onto the hard drive and I don't have to worry about them breaking the DVD player or scratching up the disks. Picture is still awesome - and it's gotten better as I've become more familiar with settings over time. Sometimes with darker movies - such as Harry Potter and the Deathly Hollows - you need to tweak the setting to see clearly during the night time scenes. There is also a little bit of a lag when browsing folder content on the hard drive. It's not like a computer where you click and it pops up, it may take 10-20 seconds to load content as you drill into the sub folders on your drive. However you can play music, look at pictures and slide shows, and watch movies loaded to digital format. This was something I wasn't aware of when I bought the set and it was a nice surprise.Update 11/2012 - Still very pleased with the TV. However it turns out that the unit I received had a problem with the HDMI ports. I originally thought it was my Blue Ray player, but after purchasing another Samsung TV and doing some troubleshooting, I figured out it was the TV. Samsung has a 1 year warranty. I opened a ticket with their customer service dept via the internet, who sent out a tech to replace the HDMI ports on the TV. I was charged nothing and the problem was resolved. I continue to be satisfied with Samsung products and was very happy with the customer service I received.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: RoxanneV
Reviews.Content: We're very happy with our new TV. The picture quality and sound are great. It's helpful to have so many options for fine-tuning color, brightness, captions, etc. Both television shows and rented DVDs are rendered with clarity.My only disappointment is that the remote isn't designed with the user in mind. The buttons aren't located in an intuitive way so that you can easily move from one function to another. It works, but you have to watch what you're doing rather than having like functions grouped.

Reviews.Title: Not as "Smart" as Samsung implies
Reviews.Author: B B
Reviews.Content: First, the good:  This TV has an excellent picture and acceptable sound.  For TV viewing I find it to be great. If they hadn't been deceptive about the web capabilities of the TV, I would have given it 5 stars.Now for the bad:  Samsung implies in the literature accompanying the TV that you can browse the web with the purchase of a USB wireless adapter.  Do not buy it for web browsing!  This TV will not browse the web.  Samsung doesn't include or offer a browser app for this TV.  You won't find out about this until it is too late, unless you first read this review, or go to Samsung's web site for customer support.  The nice little color brochure that accompanies the TV lists web browsing as one of the features you get - AFTER you shell out more $$$ for the wireless adapter.  Very deceptive.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.  Fantastic Amazon service.
Reviews.Author: usfscooter
Reviews.Content: I waited until this TV was available directly from Amazon so I could benefit from their guarantees.  I'm glad I did.  For starters, I ordered it on a Monday and received it that same Friday with free shipping!  Within an hour of using the TV it developed a bad red colored pixel at the top of the screen.  It wasn't noticeable except during dark scenes.  I followed the online return process and with in minutes I had a reply apologizing for the problem and telling me that another TV would be arriving the following Friday and that UPS would come by on Monday to pick up the bad TV.  The return worked with no problems and I didn't have to pay return shipping!  I love Amazon.The UN46D6000 has a great picture.  I find the factory presets work well but I plan on manually tweaking them when I get time.  The motion blur reduction works well for me when I have it set to "Clear".  For my Xbox I shut off the blur reduction entirely to eliminate lag.  The Smart Hub is okay.  That's not why I bought it, though.  Some of the apps are great.  I like the Google Calendar and Google Maps.  They work great.  I was able to show my son the Pyramids in Egypt and the Sphinx right from the app.  A lot of the other apps seem to be garbage.  I tried a solar system app and dinosaur app.  The descriptions were in broken English and made no sense.  The apps themselves looked great but were unusable because of the horrible translation.  I haven't tried Netflix or Blockbuster.  I don't use Facebook or Twitter so I can't speak to those either.  Several other apps I tried that would turn your TV into a picture frame displaying classic works of art were deceiving.  The app download was free but you had to pay to get the content.I watched a few minutes of Tangled on this and was blown away at how fantastic it looked.  The movement of her hair looked so natural I couldn't believe it.  I also watched a classic movie, Calamity Jane, on it.  I have never seen a classic movie look so good on a TV before.  I felt like I was watching them on stage.  I watched the AFC and NFC championship games on this as well and the colors really popped without being over saturated and the text on the uniforms was easily readable using the default Dynamic setting.  At certain times I have noticed the light bleeding in the corners that others have mentioned, but it really is not a bother even for most darker scenes.I suppose you could find another 46" TV cheaper but the others I looked at just didn't have the same picture quality.  I would definitely recommend this for someone who is picky about picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV & good value
Reviews.Author: RRubin
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with the tv since my purchase on Black Friday. I decided to buy the tv based on Samsung's quality reputation and an excellent review on Cnet.com on similar Samsung models. I recently purchased a Samsung wireless adapter and I am now enjoying the smart-tv internet features. I was pleasantly surprised how easily the tv connected to my wireless network.  I have been streaming videos on Netflix and Vudu and the video quality is great. I highly recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 47 led tv
Reviews.Author: Bruce Leon Shank
Reviews.Content: We purchased a samsung on the recommendations of family and friends. Initial setup was simple, the sound volume is ok. After 2 months of use, we are very pleased with our led tv, would not hesitate to purchase another if needed. Went to a local best buy store to purchase this unit, but the staff seemed only interested in leaning on counter, so after several minutes of ingnoring my wife and I, we went home and ordered through amazon online. Shipment was very fast!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Decent Apps, Horrendous Tech Support
Reviews.Author: David Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: If you can't connect to Netflix AND you're getting a continual update notification on the 'Your Video' app, you'll want to read this...In my case, although every other app worked without issue, I couldn't connect to Netflix. Whenever I launched the app, a dialogue box popped up, displaying 'Connecting...' and froze. I'd needed to power off the TV to get out of it.Before calling into tech support, I performed several resets of both the TV (essentially setting it to factory defaults) and Smart Hub. I also upgraded the firmware to the latest version (1025), which also took the Netflix app to the latest (3.1.3). Nothing helped.There was also an update notification for the 'Your Videos' app which kept popping up but no matter what I did, it looked as if the update couldn't be applied. I kept pointing out to the support people that the update problem was clearly related to the Netflix issue, but as others here have pointed out, they just kept blaming Netflix. Whenever they tried to close the call out, I reminded them of the update problem and pointed out that it was theirs to solve.Anyway, the support person gave me a code to punch into my remote (FF, 289, RW) which allowed me to change the 'Internet Service Region' on my TV. She had me switch over to Canada and back to the US. I was surprised that she didn't ask me to try and connect to Netflix while it was configured for Canada, but whatever. Shortly thereafter, she gave up and gave me yet another phone number for the 'Samsung Apps' people. This was tier 2 support, mind you.Before calling, I set the region to Canada again and clicked 'Your Videos' (which had previously always resulted in an update error). This time, it appeared to connect to the update server, it applied the update and, lo and behold, everything began to work, including Netflix. I changed the region back to the US and I'm up and running.My best guess is that although the Netflix app was up-to-date, it relied on a service or function of some other app which needed to the updated. And it seems that Samsung's update server, rather than Netflix, was screwing me over.Also, a warning for anyone who starts a support ticket via the support site's chat option. I did exactly that and spent 2 hrs with them, after which he gave me a 14-character (alphanumeric) 'Issue ID' and told me he was escalating the ticket to tier 2. Unfortunately, I had to hit the road and explicitly asked if I could start up another chat session later in the day and be immediately escalated to tier 2 with the issue ID. He assured me that was the case. When I tried, I was told I had to dial into the support system, as tier 2 didn't offer chat sessions. Frustrated, I called in and the automated system asked me for a 10-digit 'Transaction Number'. Since I had a 14-character ID, I was forced to request an agent. I gave her the issue id and she informed me the format was incorrect. I explained everything and she insisted I'd have to start over with her. She was rude and condescending throughout.She kept talking to me as if I were crazy for expecting to be able to escalate from the web site to the phone. I had to get just as gruff with her and I pointed out that if there wasn't a mechanism for that, Samsung shouldn't tell customers it's supported. Inversely, if it is supported, the process is obviously broken since she claimed to not recognize the format of the issue ID I was given by the web support people.Anyway, in the end I did indeed start over with her but insisted on giving her the 2-day synopsis of everything I'd done to that point before she began her troubleshooting. After relating all that, she immediately told me I needed to contact Netflix. "If all the other apps work, then it's obviously a Netflix problem". I was only able to get her to escalate by pointing out the update issue described above wasn't a Netflix responsibility and it was Samsung's to resolve. She escalated me with a terse "ThanksforcallingSamunghaveaniceday<CLICK>". in the end, the problem was resolved as described above.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: I bought the 60in TV during the Black Friday sale. I absolutely love this television and it makes all the other TVs in the house look small. It needed some work to adjust the settings to make it look just right. The apps are cool but I haven't used them since the first day as I have a laptop or smartphone to perform the same functions. All the hookups are easily accessible and the stand can rotate. The sound is fine on the TV as long as you keep it below 20 but if you want great sound then get a surround sound system. For calibration settings I copied the majority of the settings from this site with the only different being the Auto Motion Plus on Clear instead of Custom: [...]

Reviews.Title: Great HD TV
Reviews.Author: Bettie G. Moss "psykey"
Reviews.Content: Others have gone into all the technical stuff and that's not my thing so here's a review from a non-techie.  Beautiful picture, great sound, easy to put together and set up.  Especially want to comment on the sound since others have dissed it.  We listen to classical music and opera nearly all day and the sound compares favorably to a stereo system for that type of music.  Also, the sound clarity and breadth remains excellent even at extremely low volume.  We have no problems viewing in daylight and the "mirror" effect others have complained about disappears when there is anything on the screen.  No light bleed around any edges.  Not completely sure whether the difference in viewing between the LED and LCD (cheaper) is worth it but we are very happy with the LED version.

Reviews.Title: Super Pleased!
Reviews.Author: Robert Borkowski "johnnyeclectic"
Reviews.Content: After a week with this TV, we are thrilled with our investment. We had no interest in 3D or a super-duper connected TV, and this seemed to be the best Samsung we could get without 3D. The picture clarity is seriously impressive, and whatever magic they are working to remove motion blur sure is working; coming from an old 32" LCD, it's changed how we watch TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40 inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: William M. Urban
Reviews.Content: Large screen gives the feeling of 3-d tv, excellent sound, easy controls, very attractive, easy to move and easy to hook up

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price and brand
Reviews.Author: Megan W "Megan W"
Reviews.Content: Have had no issues with it. Do note that it doesn't work with the Amazon Prime instant tv streaming though.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Niko
Reviews.Content: Just the best picture I've ever seen. I'm using it as a monitor for my laptop, no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: T. Conklin
Reviews.Content: I bought the Samsung UN40D6000 TV at HH Gregg for $658 + tax on 12/23/11. (It was $730 on Amazon at that time)The TV has been phenomenal so far. The picture is amazing. I did change a few of the default settings out of the box as others have described - but I'm not sure it was really all that needed. I have not noticed any of the backlight bleed-through in the corners that some others have mentioned.I have the sound hooked up through my surround system - so I can't comment on the quality of the TV speakers. I also have not tried the network applications yet either.Would definitely buy again!**** Update 2/27/12 ****I connected the TV via a wired connection to my home network. I was quickly able to use some the network applications such as Netflix, Youtube, Googlemaps. Everything has worked just fine ... my only complaint is that the lack of a QWERTY keyboard makes entering search strings very cumbersome. I was pleasantly suprised by the quality of the sound coming from the TV speakers based on comments by some of the other reviewers. While it's not surround sound quality - I found the TV speakers to be totally acceptable.I have now also noticed the backlight bleed-through in the corners. It is very minor and only noticeable when the screen is completely black. It is not something I can see when an actual video is on display.I continue to be very happy with the TV and would still buy again!

Reviews.Title: Good deal for 120mhz LED
Reviews.Author: Cory
Reviews.Content: This tv has no flaws with its output.. Couldnt be more happier with the purchase of it. i use it primarily for games and the quality is superb. Dont buy any accessories for it (wireless adapter (u can update the firmware via usb) or any kind.Buy it and you wont be dissapointed with it.

Reviews.Title: I am a Samsung customer forever!
Reviews.Author: hipd
Reviews.Content: I bought my Samsung tv as a gift for my husband on Cyber Monday and he says its the best gift' I have ever given him. This item is gorgeous, and the picture is unbelievable. I also like how easy it was to set up with the blue ray and digital router. We are enjoying this purchase and I will look for this companys product each time I look for electronics.  Amazon is wonderful. Thanks for the detailed suggestions for accessories that made my Samsung tv work at optimal condition.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: kushlik
Reviews.Content: Very good picture quality, though some bleeding on the edges is present. Nevertheless, totally worth it. Built-in apps make it easy to watch Netflix, etc, and can plug in any hard drive of flash drive and play AVI movies with no problem

Reviews.Title: great product and great price BETTER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: bossmbz
Reviews.Content: I moved up from a 37in to this 55 in. I was worried that it might be TOO big for the room, but worked out great. The picture is amazing. I looked at PANI plasma, LG, SONY, etc and spent way too much time at BB comparing over and over again.I kept coming back to this one. When AMAZON dropped the price to match BB ad just before BLACK FRIDAY, I pulled the trigger and bought it from AMAZON. The best surprise was the WHITE GLOVE delivery.The freight company called to arrange the delivery and I figured they would drop it off and leave. NO, they came in, opened it, assembled it, placed it on the TV stand, plugged it in and tested it before they left. FANTASTIC !!!!Once again AMAZON has delivered superior product with superior service.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 HDTV
Reviews.Author: JohnGalloway
Reviews.Content: Samsung HDTV has an incredible picture and is easy to operate. It was easy to unpack and assemble. I matched it with a Samsung Blue ray with a Wi-Fi antena and can connect to the Net. I get great movies streamed from Netflix and others but not Amazon Prime because Samsung does not offer an app for it. I would buy this TV again as well as the Blue-ray from Samsung

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Moses M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Its a very good TV. It also has a remote that works anywhere in the room. I was thinking the price was a little too high, at least until I saw the 2300.00 best was charging. I didnt like that it didnt have built in wireless. It is wifi ready, that means you need to spend 80.00 to get a adapter. I think the speed of the samsung adapter is too slow. Other then that its a good buy.

Reviews.Title: The product is Fabulous...Value for money and beyond!
Reviews.Author: MM
Reviews.Content: The product is very nice...hits all the check-marks in my must have list:1. This is a better product for people who want at-least a 40" LED TV2. 120 Hz refresh, excellent contrast ratio, great picture quality, 4 HDMI ports, numerous out/in ports for all devices [PS, Blu-ray, computer,DVR, STB]3. Many online smart services [my blu-ray had almost everything except you-tube]4. Very nice to look at, including the stand.5. One of the better older and value-for money if you get it for ~800 USD6. You can play virtually any media file using the two USB ports.7. Would suggest you connect the TV through a LAN cable, the speed might be a bit of an issue.8. Agree with most of the reviews...sound neeeds to be better...but if you have a 5.1 audio system [I got that too!] then you will never need to use it. My suggestion , if you want such a slim TV, be prepared for gorgeous pictures and compromise for the sound...sound through the 5.1 is is great, though it still depends on the content.Finally ..great product...keep it up samsung, amazon!P.S. : I purchased it in the Black Friday sale hence had many issues with the delivery timelines and the limited-information responses I got from Amazon Customer Care. However I consider with millions of orders on these special sale days , some times these delays do happen.

Reviews.Title: Best TV at the Best price
Reviews.Author: alfredo
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for 3 weeks and I couldn't be more satisfied with the purchase I made.  I did a lot research for my, and my family's needs and decided to go with this model.  I was a little afraid for some reviews I read and those people were exagetating.  The picture is so clear, the apps and smart hub is great, the best.  If you are not into 3D, and web browsing this is the tv to go with.  I bought it at 1,097.99 with free shipping, now the price is a little higher but it is still worth it

Reviews.Title: Great picture, slow menu response, dlna support dicey
Reviews.Author: Wisconsin Gardener "Meriwether"
Reviews.Content: Picked up this TV over the weekend (11/26/2011) at Best Buy (sorry Amazon, the deal with Discover Card site cashback was too good). First the good. I shied away from a plasma because the room this is in gets a lot of light that can't be blocked. Not a problem for this TV. The picture is excellent in any light, good viewing angles. That's about it for the good, though that's a lot. I can't stress enough how good the picture is. We have two Vizio Razors (120 hz) and this thing blows them away. My sceptical wife was amazed. Also, this thing is unbelievably thin. Now the bad, or at least the not so good. The build quality is really suspect. The piece of sheet metal on the back doesn't really seem to fit properly. The ports are not centered in the holes, it just gives you the impression that that the design and/or manufacturing is not that good. The screws that hold the back in place are not driven straight and stick up. Obviously not designed by Apple. OK, so what. The picture is great. But... one of the primary reasons I got this TV was support for dlna. What a disaster. Not sure if this is a Samsung or Microsoft problem but, though it sees the content on my Windows Home Server, it can't play it (file format not supported). Support, documentation is non-existent. The Smart TV functions work (Netflix, Hulu Plus, etc.) but the interface is painfully, I mean really painfully slow. Our 3 year old Wii blows this thing away. On a last good note, though you won't see it on the box, it has a wired Ethernet port, so if available, you can avoid buying the wireless adaptor. Makes this a good deal over the 6003 which though it includes a wireless NIC, is more expensive, or at least was. No flashlight as others have reported.

Reviews.Title: You got to love this.
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I got a low price guarantee on this LED piece and perfectly fits my apartment size. Normally I am a Sony fan but this is my first trial with samsung and it did not disappoint. I was suspicious about the price and whether it was worth the money spent and indeed it is. I got my Blu Ray, Receiver, Home theater, DVR and my imac connected to it and getting the maximum use out of it. I had a to buy a Samsumg Linkstic (bought from amazon) to wirelessly connect to internet. And using the media share option i can connect my phome to the tv using wifi. The only disappointment is the smart tv apps which are not user friendly. But i compensated it by connecting my imac to the tv using a DVI to HDMI convertor and and Mediabridge HDMI cable (bought from amazon) which gives me a 1080p resolution from the mac to the tv. VUDU as always delivers perfectly. Want to thank Amazon for answering to all my needs. Amazon rocks.

Reviews.Title: Great image quality!
Reviews.Author: Banito81
Reviews.Content: I loved this TV because of the image quality it offers and all the internet options now with the new Samsung Apps and 3rd partner sites.Probably sound quality is not really great but it is fair for our medium-size bedroom.

Reviews.Title: 55D6000
Reviews.Author: eeocbid
Reviews.Content: Impressed with in the room delivery, box opened just far enough to plug in and get to the set-up screen displayed.  No blemishes and elegant thin, light and stylish design of screen.  Picture quality is very good with the best source of HD content.  Sometimes with sitcoms, it looks too clear, but have some motion issues. Ghosting is more prevalent on the sitcoms, than the sports programs, even with trying several of the motion plus settings available in the menu.  Enough inputs, yet more is always a future need not a current need.  No WIFI included, you need to purchase a $50+ proprietary USB dongle.  Very happy with purchase and like the super low energy use and heat producing features since I air condition more than heat in AZ.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Louis "jlo0312"
Reviews.Content: This 46" TV is simply awesome. Fantastic picture, easy to use features, and great sound all in one package. Definitely recommend this flat screen!

Reviews.Title: Loving this purchase
Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: I have had my television for about 6 weeks now and I have not had any problems with it at all. The picture quality and the sound are both great.  It was so easy to mount on the stand which I think is so nice with the beveled glass front of the television.  I would not hesitate to purchase another Samsung Smart TV.  I use the apps on it as well and setting those up was a breeze.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for great quality at a reasonable price. I had researched this tv at my local store and played with it at the store however it was cheaper online than in the store and with the adapter I had no problems getting it to work wirelessly in my home.  I mean listening to my favorite music or watching movies right from the Netflix app directly on my tv is wonderful.If you are going to spend money on a tv , you may as well get something that serves multiple purposes as this tv does.

Reviews.Title: Meets Expectations
Reviews.Author: Jacob J. Bingen "Octopus"
Reviews.Content: Shipped within date range defined. TV works as expected.  Image quality is superb and beats the Samsung 42" LCD in the living room.  I purchased the Samsung wireless USB adapter, TV picked this up with no issues.  Connecting to the network took less time then unpacking the TV.The applications are immature.  As soon as 'Smart Hub' is launched on first launch it requires and updated.  Then after TV restart another update is needed.  This to me means Samsung is trying update these applications to make them better.  All the applications work they could just all work better.  Or perhaps be more useful.One of the main reasons why I brought this TV was for the DLNA ability.  This works but could work better.  I have a D-LINK DNS-323 NAS server.  Some of the content (wma, mpg) files can be read off this server.  Other files with this same exact format can not be read.  I do not understand why, something with the codec or audio. I attempted to convert my .vob files into this format using different codec and could not find a match the TV could display.  Maybe it can not translate all these files on the fly. I do not know.  I do not know if you are going to find a 'Smart TV' able to read any file format off a network connected storage device.This was not unexpected.  I read reviews about this not working before I brought this TV. So I then installed this service called Serviio on my local Windows 7 machine.  This piece of software translates movies on the fly into a format the TV can read.  The software picks up the TV.  This piece of software needs to be installed on a windows based machine to it can translate the media.  I then mapped a network drive to the NAS server.  I then setup Serviio to read this mapped drive on my local machine.  The TV is then able to display basically any type of format I place on the NAS.  The TV streams these files without any issues.  I can only pause and play the movie, no fast forward or rewind.  I can however do this locally with a flash drive plugged into the TV.  This is minor.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely wonderful TV but...
Reviews.Author: yipikaye
Reviews.Content: This TV is definitely the best bang for your buck you get can as I write this.  It is very thin, the colors and image quality is astonishing. The only bummer about the TV is the Auto Motion Plus 120hz, which gives you that kind of "soap opera" effect. While the smoothing works very nicely, the processor doesn't seem to be strong enough to handle it. As a result, the image stutters a lot when the feature is beyond Clear (Standard and Smooth stutters like crazy).You definitely need to put the Game Mode ON if you want to play games.Overall a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: The Hagg "haggard85"
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic! I shopped around and ended up getting it from Costco because for $100 they'll give you a 5 year warranty!!!  This TV is great and the Smart Hub makes it worth the investment!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Raghu
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV!!!! Good purchase..The picture quality is very good. Auto motion plus feature is very good. Our major concern was to watch movie like a movie, not like a live show.Auto motion plus resolves this. One more good feature is samsung App Store. The apps are good..The picture quality and the sound quality are also good.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, no "flashlight" problems!
Reviews.Author: R. George "rgeorge"
Reviews.Content: We have not had any "flashlight" problems with this TV as other reviewers have mentioned. Our TV is beautiful and has had zero issues in the two weeks that we've had it.Picture is beautiful. It took a few minutes to figure out how to turn the "smooth motion" filter off. It makes Blu-ray movies look fake. Otherwise, set-up is easy and trouble free.Sound is fine. What I would expect for a TV that is 1 inch thick. Its not super high quality, but just fine for watching TV. I have not had the chance to test the internet capabilities as we just use the PS3 that is hooked up to the TV for anything internet related. You can see reflections on the glossy screen when it is turned off, but with the TV on, we have zero glare issues.Very happy with our purchase!EDIT (2/16/2012): After several months of ownership, the TV still works great. However, I have started to notice the "flashlight" problems that others have mentioned. I only see it when the screen is black with some white text (for example, credits of a movie). During this situation, you can see a "flashlight" at each corner of the screen. Mine is faint and it doesn't even bother me, but its there. During normal viewing situations, or if the lights in the room are on, you can't even see it.If the flashlight effect bothers you, get a backlit TV and not an edgelit.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Texas50 "economist13"
Reviews.Content: Based on reading other reviews I was confident that the picture would be high quality, which it is. I am very pleased. What I was less sure about was the sound quality, particuarly given how thin the unit is. Nevertheless, I was pleasantly surprised that the volume can be driven quite high without distortion and that it the sound quality was quite good for a television, as opposed to a separate home theater system. I have had several other televisions in the past few years and the sound quality on this one was better than the others. All in all, I am very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: When in doubt...Go Samsung...
Reviews.Author: Taylor J. Clark
Reviews.Content: I just upgraded from a Samsung 60hz LCD, 40" flat screen that is a couple years old. I found this TV at a steal. If you are having doubts about buying this TV....let me erase them. This is the best LED TV I've seen on the market today. In the TV world it may be a few bucks more, but you get what you pay for. This TV has a beautiful picture, set up is a breeze...and it truly does bring out my HD DirectTV and Samsung blu ray player's full potential.Pros:-  Beautiful picture with over 5,000,000:1 contrast ratio. The motion blur technology I think works great.-  Thin as a sheet of paper-  Screen is high gloss, which provides a better picture-  Easy set up-  Has BD wise with a compatible blu ray player that automatically adjusts settings for optimum picture brillianceCons:-  If you are into the whole Smart TV thing (which this is a Smart TV) there isn't much by way of features on the Hub. For me? Who cares.-  High gloss screen- (on the downside of being great for picture, can cause a bit of glare during the day. Not enough to bother me, but it may for some people.There ya go people. This TV is boss. I'm a huge stickler for picture, and am big into the HD scene. I did a lot of research before I bought this, and hours and hours of comparissons with others. If you want a tv that will last for years and years to come with the most brilliant picture around, go for this one. You wont be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Shines Again
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A McCauley
Reviews.Content: This is my second samsung television purchase.  The television has a fantastic picture quality.  It is crisp, clean, and the colors are fantastic.  The sound is clear, loud enough, but it is hung on the wall in my bedroom so I am not really cranking it.  The television is thin, light, and the menu options are easy to navigate.The tv came in via amazon and I am pleased to say there was no damage and the delivery was fantastically quick.  I tried to get best buy to price match and they refused.  I was able to save $220 using amazon.

Reviews.Title: I am glad I spent the extra bucks
Reviews.Author: David Budlong "President, Ace Handyman Servic...
Reviews.Content: It all started at a warehouse store where I found a 52" Sharp LED LCD TV on sale for an incredible price. After bringing it home, turning it on and seeing the difference in the picture, I was hooked on LED 1080p TVs.So now I had to replace the TV in the bedroom. Where I live I can park between 2 stores, the warehouse store that has to do with costs (would have bought here if they had this model, their customer service is awesome), and an electronic store that deals with buys (btw this store has the worst customer service, 1.5 hours in store and not asked if I needed help once). I spent several hours going back and forth comparing the TV's at both stores.What I realized was that my $350 budget needed to be increased to $900 if I wanted the TV I wanted. So I came home without a TV that day, yet determined to buy a 32" 1080p LED LCD Smart TV that looked good, and the Samsung UN32D6000 was the preferred set. The Vizio was ugly, and the other brands I had never heard of.Finding the Amazon warehouse with open box buys was my ticket to the new TV I wanted. I was able to purchase this TV for under $600 delivered to my door. Yippee! I pushed the button to order on Sunday and had the new set on Wednesday. Can't beat that!Now the TV was all that I expected from reading the reviews. Awesome clear picture that almost feels like you are in the show with the actors. Easy set up. Fairly good sound for the application, I mean it is in the bedroom and used mostly for morning news and putting us to sleep at night. Though I might be spending more time in there now!Not only has Samsung made a TV that is both stylish and thin, it works awesome too. It is almost like a piece of art hanging on the wall.I am very pleased with this purchase and would highly recommend anyone to spend a few extra bucks and go for the better TV. And buying it from Amazon's warehouse as an open box, is a no worry situation, you can buy with confidence!Hope this helps you in making your decision.

Reviews.Title: Picture is so sharp!
Reviews.Author: Paul & Liz Smith
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for our exercise room and now wish we had it as our main TV. The picture is incredibly sharp and viewable from all angles. We mounted it to the wall and we had no trouble lifting it as it only weights 33 lbs.  It works seamlessly with a Samsung BluRay player- both remotes work both devices. We often watch Netflix via a hardwired connection and the streaming speed is wonderful. The only thing missing is free Hulu, although Hulu Plus is available.We are VERY pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Easy
Reviews.Author: James T. Rague
Reviews.Content: Everything about this purchase was great. T.V. arrived super fast. Set up was simple and quality is outstanding. So far could not be happier...will see what time brings.

Reviews.Title: Total Bargain!
Reviews.Author: a-mused "a-mused67"
Reviews.Content: Caveat:  I'm a fairly critical judge and don't readily hand out five stars.This Samsung is a screaming deal.  Samsung quality, LED backlighting (edge, not array), excellent design at a bargain price.  Having lived with this TV for a month now, I haven't experienced any lighting or audio issues.  Blacks are black. Colors are vibrant.  Rapid motion issues are subtle and disappear with the "smart motion" feature (though I recommend leaving that off most of the time).  I can see where some might have a glare problem, but where we have this tv, the problem doesn't exist.  I had been considering a Vizio 55", but I found this Samsung on sale and at the same price point as the Vizio.  There is *no* comparison between the two.  The Samsung is far superior on every count.

Reviews.Title: Samsung has really excelled in development.
Reviews.Author: I8UNtheV
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 3 months now and have no complaints. I wall mounted it using a 15mm slim wire mount. It looks like I almost inset it into the wall. Supper slim and sexy. Blu-Ray looks phenomenal with the 120Hz refresh rate. It takes some getting use to from a standard 60Hz TV. The LED gets bright but I have a lot of light in the entertainment room and some time it doesn't cut it. (But nothing on the market does.) So if you are looking for a low maintenance, low energy, crystal clear picture than you will want to invest in this. Even the Menu screen looks good. Samsung you now have earned my loyalty. Sorry Sony.

Reviews.Title: Stunning!
Reviews.Author: RP McMurphy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture...Great price...and all you need to transform your viewing experience to a SCREENING experience. You might have to tweak the pix slightly to tone down the electric, overly bright nature of LED, but it's all about options and you have plenty of them in the accessible user-friendly settings. This set should definitely be a worthy consideration.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32D6000 Review
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: The Samsung 32" UN32D6000 is a beautiful looking LED-TV.  I have always gone with Samsung televisions... This is my 5th Samsung, and I love them all.  It seems with each one, they get better and better.  The picture on this TV, is outstanding, 1080p 120hz with 5,000,000 contrast on a 32" screen is insane, its like tv heaven...lol.  This is my first Samsung with Internet Apps, I haven't tried them all yet, but I have tried the You Tube app, and it works well, The only negative thing, is having to type in your search with the remote...Hopefully Samsung will release a QWERTY remote.  Also, Most LED-TV without MicroDimming Technology like on the 8 series Samsung, will have minor light bleed thru in dark room w/ dark scene.  I have not noticed any on this Samsung... Usually if you turn off all your lights in a room, at night, in a dark scene on a led-tv you may see very minor light bleed...I would def. recommend this tv to a friend, Once ya go Samsung, ya don't go back.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32D6000 review
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound quality of the Samsung UN32D6000 are excellent. The price is a bit high, but overall this tv seems to be a solid winner. Also, you can't go wrong when you purchase from amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: "A OK"
Reviews.Author: Eleanor
Reviews.Content: We are pleased with this purchase.  We ordered it one day, got it delivered to our door the next and the price was less than the store price.The TV exceeds our expectations.  Now, if you had given me better instructions about the internet feature hookup, that would have been a big help.  So far I have not been game to tackle that.

Reviews.Title: Samsung needs to Treat Me Right!
Reviews.Author: J. Newton
Reviews.Content: First off, I have the 6003 version, which was the Black Friday special.  I wanted to love this set as it is my first step up from a sanyo 30" widescreen CRT TV. After lots of research this set seemed like a good choice at a good price. I even could live with the light leakage problem (I Think) as I've fiddled with the settings enough to acceptably view DVDs. Imagine my surprise when a green line 2 pixels wide appears vertically on my screen! Yah! The set didn't even make it three weeks in my living room!!! So now I'm waiting for a whole new panel to be replaced. Does that make my set "New" or "Refurbished"? So there's a rumour that these sets were made with less than the best parts and perhaps I'm getting a better panel? My concern is that the light leakage (which IS a problem) may be worse or totally unacceptable with the new panel.  It now seems that my choice is between Samsung and LG because Sony is now Sammy and I want to stay with LCD/LED technology. This TV looks absolutely stunning when all factors are working but it's been a crappy road so far. Not to mention burning it in 100 hours+ to look for dead pixels; and never mind Samsung's dire warning about watching anything in 4:3 ratio- which is completely assinine and Not A Problem according to Sony and Toshiba customer services. Seems like one can't buy something and expect it it function like it's supposed to!!!

Reviews.Title: Mild disappointment
Reviews.Author: GreenJim
Reviews.Content: I have had an excellent 46" Samsung LCD unit for several years and was impressed enough to purchase this LED model when the Amazon price dropped to $899, to replace an ailing CRT TV.  The multiple input options was another important selling point.The 120Hz did help alleviate some motion anomalies.However, there were some deficits to this model:Light bleed at each corner.  At each of the 4 corners, light shone out in an approximately 2" triangle.  It was most noticeable when viewing 3:4 media.Audio was markedly less clear.  Compared to the Samsung 46" LCD unit, the audio lacked clarity and required higher volume settings.I watch a variety of video in differing aspects - 16:9, 3:4, full screen, letterbox. On other Samsung models, changing the aspect was relatively straight-forward, a couple of keystrokes.  This model required more obscure finagling to change the view.Again, I use several different input sources.  The buttons on the remote control for changing source input are not logically placed.Maneuvering the digital manual was clumsy.  Considering the progress of computers/programming over the last 30 years, I'd expect something less clunky.Once I delve into the "Smart TV" offerings, I'll add to this review.

Reviews.Title: "Great unit, until something breaks"
Reviews.Author: R. Perez "gadget afficionado"
Reviews.Content: (PLEASE NOTE: This review is not about this tv set, it is mainly about Samsung and the way I was treated with their customer service. I purchased an LN40C650 just over a year ago. The review is posted on that product on Amazon, and I wanted to share my experiences with Samsung for anyone and everyone to see.)------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I want to start off by saying that the Samsung LN40C650 tv set is great. The picture quality is awesome, local and internet streaming work perfectly, and I was extremely satisfied with this unit, until...About a week after my 1 year warranty expired, I began to have problems with the ethernet adapter on the tv. I called Samsung to see what troubleshooting steps I could take to resolve my issue. The problem was that no matter what cable I used or what port on the router was used, the tv could not connect to my network. (Keep in mind that I am a network technician and understand how networks work, and knew exactly what the problem was.) After relaying that same information to multiple agents when calling Samsung, every time I called they wanted me to go through the same troubleshooting steps. I informed them that the problem was with the ethernet adapter on the television. When the tv was plugged in, the router light would never come on, and it would never get an IP address from my router. To test this, I plugged in a laptop using that same cable, and it immediately worked without any problems. So I knew that the ethernet port was the problem and not my router (which I have two routers, and tried both of them).So, after speaking with multiple reps at Samsung, I finally spoke to an agent who I believed was going to help me. Myself and the agent went through the same troubleshooting steps, but still unable to resolve the issue. So he asked if I had registered my product to be eligible to have my warranty extended for 3 months. I told him that I had registered, and he looked up that information successfully. I even received an email stating that my warranty had been extended for three months. The agent then proceeded to get a work order so that a technician would contact me to setup service. At this point, I am under the impression that I will be covered under the extended 3-months. (To make a long story short) I received a call from the Samsung technician in my area, and stated that Samsung did not inform him that my tv was under warranty and stated that Samsung would have to send documentation that it is still under warranty. So I contacted Samsung, once again, and I was told that since the unit was out of the first year warranty, I would not be able to have my tv repaired, and that I would be responsible for the service if I decided to have it serviced. I even forwarded the email that I received about my extended 3 months of warranty to the Samsung rep, and was told that they could not honor that warranty, and I would be responsible for the service.I am not here to bash Samsung for the way I was treated. I understand that I was out of my warranty at the time when I started having issues, and I understand that they technically do not have to provide me with anything. I am simply writing this to inform potential buyers of my issues with this television set and how my issues was 'resolved' by Samsung. This is more to inform you about the company, more than it is about this specific product, which if the one i purchased.I reiterate, this product looks fantastic. It has the ability to stream Netflix, Hulu, MLB.TV, Youtube, etc. I even have a few DLNA applications(such as PlayOn, Twonky, and a Windows Home Server with built in Media Server capabilities) and this television played all of my media (videos, music, and photos) that were located on my server and my main computer.But, please be informed that if you begin to have issues, even just a day out of your warranty, you are on your own.

Reviews.Title: Get ready to be blown away!
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: I've been searching for a 55" LED for about a year now, and have finally found the UN55D6000!  Amazing video, decent audio, extremely thin, and more than enough HD Inputs....this tv has it all.Go to your local electronics store and you'll see why Samsung is revered as #1 in HDTVs.  This thing looks ridiculous wall-mounted above my fireplace!Pros:Vivid PictureSharp video and fast motionGood SpeakersVery SlimFour HDMI InputsAttractive Thin BezelUnder 40 lbs.Smart TV with Samsung AppsEnergy Efficienthgih-end features at a Low PriceCons:Needs Samsung USB WiFi Adapter (sold separately)No 3D (won't bother some ppl)

Reviews.Title: A great television
Reviews.Author: G. L. Davis
Reviews.Content: This LED television has the best picture I have ever seen.  I'm not into the 3D models yet but this one is great.  The BluRay movie "Avatar" is perfect on this set.  The television is a Samsung and connected to a Samsung BluRay player it is not hard to operate.  Mark my word you won't be disappointed if you purchase one.

Reviews.Title: I got what I paid for. (Go figure) :)
Reviews.Author: I8UNtheV
Reviews.Content: This was my choice to go with in my Man Cave Theater Room Dungeon of Blu-Ray. I am particular to Samsung first of all. I like the set up, look, and functionality. I was a little skeptical of the clouding issue, especially on a screen this size. I had none. The picture quality it excellent. The speakers are poop. What do you expect on a TV this thin. And if you buy a TV this expensive than you should have the dough to get at least decent soundbar. I have a great surround sound system so I didn't care if it had speakers at all as long as it had an audio out. Internet capabilities are mediocre. I like the idea but its obvious to see that its in the first stages. If you want an amazing TV get this. If you want is to be a surround sound capable computer, don't.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Mntnmama
Reviews.Content: I got this tv because I don't want cable and wanted to be able to watch tv shows thru the internet. This was easy to set up, hooked right up to my wireless network with the wireless adapter (purchased separately). It has great picture quality, the sound has to be up around 40 to hear when there is other noise in the house (kids playing).The smarthub is cool, but I can't figure out how to personalize it to get rid of some of the recommendations such as espn. Other than that, it is nice to easily access netflix and hulu. Unfortunately not all of hulu's programming can be watched via the tv. However this is easily remedied by hooking your pc to the tv and stream it thru an hdmi cable.My only complaint is the web browser is clunky and I cannot figure out how to surf the web thru the tv. It seems to only want to search youtube or facebook. Still messing around with this feature...Other than that, this is a great tv for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing HDTV
Reviews.Author: King of the North
Reviews.Content: The first time you pop in a blu-ray and watch it on this tv you will be blown away. And im not coming from a tube tv to this i have a 42in Panasonic plasma which is a great TV.but this thing takes the cake i love it.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: R. Williams
Reviews.Content: Well, this is the first time and possibly the last time I'll order something from the "Amazon returns department".  I ordered this TV to replace an old one in our bedroom.  The TV arrived quickly and appeared to be almost new.  Here's a quick pro's and cons list.Pros:Easy set-up and installationGreat pictureMany TV options for both audio and videoSelf diagnosticsCons:Static on all sources - tried different cables and set-up, but all sources had noticeable static from cable TV to the DVD playerFingerprint magnet - shiny finish shows any fingerprints, also required to touch TV panels to turn on/offHard to find on/off switch on TV, buttons and built into frame and not litI can't help but be upset about receiving what I suspect was a returned defective unit.  Obviously the unit was previously returned and now I paid for shipping to get the same broke TV that someone else had already returned.  Amazon needs to make it more clear as to why a unit was returned to them, especially if they intend to resell these units as is.  It's different for a refurbished unit, but returned ones need to be checked for damage/malfunctions.  So, what would otherwise be a great TV has to be returned at additional time to me as we all know how fun it is to take apart a product and put it back into the original packaging.  I have since ordered a different TV from Panasonic, new and unused this time.

Reviews.Title: It could have been better
Reviews.Author: A. Dwivedi "AD"
Reviews.Content: The rating for this TV will depend on what you are looking for. It's an pricy TV (750$ for 32inch).Pros:1. Very sleek and light weight.2. Very good picture quality.3. You can play YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, Facebook (and other Samsung apps).Cons:1. Sound quality could have been better (its good and clear but not like home theater).2. Playing YouTube etc. is cool but going through provided remote is a real pain (almost impossible) because you have to select letters one by one. There is a Samsung IPhone Remote app but that is also not great (there are some bugs like if you start the app before starting the TV it cannot find the TV until you restart the iPhone. Also YouTube app doesn't support the Samsung Remote App to type and search the video, so you have to use Samsung search feature (which is good)).3. TV supports WIFI but you have to buy Samsung Link Stick wireless LAN adapter (50-60$ more) to make it work over WIFI (it supports Ethernet port too but Netflix works over WiFi only).4. Samsung app store is not mature enough (will take some time I think).5. No web browser.So all in all its a very good, sleek, light weight, stylish TV with very good picture quality but I think 750$ (800$ with adapter) is still very high because you can get same picture quality LCD TVs in 400-500$. So if you care for sleek and light weight (you'll not lift it everyday :)) and name Smart TV buy it, otherwise any other TV should be able to suffice your requirements.Note: I have heard that bigger sizes Samsung smart TVs like 46 and 55 inch doesn't require wireless adapter and they have Qwetry Remote and also web browser.

Reviews.Title: Research comments
Reviews.Author: R. Crews "Traveler"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv but have yet to receive it. However I recently discovered an attribute that I thought others considering the purchase should be aware of. I was planning to use the tv digital optical output to couple the audio output to my home theater receiver and couple my components directly to the tv by HDMI cables without using the tv internal speakers. If you wish to try this approach I found a tech review on the Crutchfield web site that states the tv optical digital output only outputs two channel sound to the home theater receiver from HDMI components connected directly to the tv.
