One thing I did not mention is my Wireless Router is on the other side of the house, so my speed on average is 6 to 9M a second. Not super fast, but the Netflix playback has been flawless. I also purchased a wireless extender, but haven't set it up and that might be going back.Now one feature I like and dislike.  I also purchased a Sony BDP-S780 BluRay to go with the tv. What is great, when you start the player, the tv automatically switches to the HDMI 2. That's perfect. But when you are done and power off the BluRay, it goes to the source TV instead of the HDMI 1 where the ATT source is. I haven't spent a lot of time playing with it and for me it's not a big deal, but to a 78 year old mom, it gets confusing on what button to press to watch TV again.  I'll dig some more to see what options there are, but that and the sound are my only complaints.Overall, this is a great TV and you will not go wrong with this purchase.  The UN32D6000 is a 99% perfect TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: This television is very nice and the picture qauality is great.  Although the sound is good, I think it could be much better.  I understand it can be attached to a surround sound system to enhance it.  I would nonetheless recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Bug-eyed
Reviews.Author: SwampFox
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time, in good condition, was exactly as ordered.  Installation is easy, connections are straight forward. Picture is great - clear, colors vivid, and high resolution jpg uploads are likewise clear.  The sound is acceptable.  Scenes shot in low lighting appear a little too dark for my taste, but can be easily adjusted.  With the many adjustments (picture size, smart hub, apps, sound mode sleep timer and etc.) that can be made anyone should be satisfied with this TV selection.  I would recommend to anyone and would buy again.

Reviews.Title: 40 " Samsung HD TV
Reviews.Author: Patricia H. Fitzer
Reviews.Content: This is our first flat screen TV and our first HD TV. We couldn't be happier with all aspects of SAmsung's product. Buying through Amazon saved us a lot of money in cost, no taxes and free shipping. The package arrived at our door with the UPS driver and it was in perfect condition. I highly recommend the Samsung TV and Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40D6000 LED TV
Reviews.Author: BALAJI PARAMASIVAM
Reviews.Content: First thing I noticed about this TV was its weight. It is so light that a normal person can handle it (Carry/Setup) on his own. The setup was a breeze. When I switched on the TV, the picture quality just blew me away. Watched few blu ray videos and it was a experience of my life. What an amazing display !!!! The speakers are little bad for a 40 inch LED TV. Could have been better. As I am planning to buy a home theater, I am not really worried about it. The internet set up was easy. Plug your Ethernet cable and you are ready to stream in 5 minutes. The on-demand apps are costly compared to a normal cable. So look out before you would sign up for anything. The weird thing with this TV is its remote. Not a user friendly remote to search something in You tube. I will be happy if Samsung releases a different version of the remote for its Apps. Overall, I am happy with the purchase. Will update the review if I find something.Last but not the least, Samsung LED TV lives to its name.

Reviews.Title: Happy customer, but wish I bought bigger
Reviews.Author: erie eagle
Reviews.Content: Wish I would have bought a larger TV but I was having a gas fireplace built in my back room and the installer could not tell me how much space I would have for a TV. I looked and many TV's at the Home centers and internet. I decided I liked the Samsung. The price was better than anything you could do in a retail store. I saved $150.00 by buying thru this site and the TV is absolutly great. However you may have to increase your internet speed in order to get Net Flix and other sites. I had Time Warner Road Runner basic, had to upgrade to Standard and still have a slight problem.

Reviews.Title: great set, a few downsides
Reviews.Author: Christopher S. Pflaumer
Reviews.Content: i love the set, and since im not real good with reviews, i'll do a pros/cons list.Pros:thin, sleek designmotion plus really adds to hi-def tv and gamesdeep blacks and great color without much adjustmentnice and loud without distortionsettings ui is pretty goodCons:i have a bit of backlight bleeding at the top corners (this is an edge-lit display)capacitive touch button on the set are tough to see even in a well-lit roomfinding a good medium on volume can be a challengeinternet connectivity is ethernet onlyi have yet to use the internet apps that come with the tv, as my router is not close to the tv. i will update this review after i give the apps a good run through

Reviews.Title: picked right 3rd time...
Reviews.Author: M. K. Lock
Reviews.Content: So, this Samsung TV was chosen for the lounge in my new apartment. The room is about 18' by 12' and I had originally figured that a 32" screen would be fine.I ordered the little brother to this Samsung, the UN32D6000, but found it too small. The picture was wonderful but I sent it back. Then I tried the LG37LE5300, as a step up in size. There are no Samsung 37" screens and I thought they would be very similar between the brands. Boy, how wrong I was. The LG looked good, very slim and elegant. However, that was as good as it got. The screen displayed extreme clouding on black backgrounds and the sound was very weak. Also the navigation seemed complicated. I sent it back and ordered the Samsung UN40D6000.I should have done this first time round. My concern that it would be too big and be dominating in the room was unfounded; it fits in just fine. This tv has a remarkable picture and needed almost no adjustment out of the box.  Blu Ray is amazing and even regular dvd looks better than I have seen on any other tv. The sound quality is what you would expect from such a skinny set, so I added a ZVOX 550 soundbar. It does not give a 5.1 soundstage, but bass is present and vocals are really clear.I'm loving this tv and would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: So Far It's Great
Reviews.Author: JiminyC "Jiminy"
Reviews.Content: RELIABILITY - UNKNOWN BUT HOPEFULI've had this TV for 2 or 3 weeks now and it was bought to replace a Visio 1080p that blew out after 1-1/2 years.  I don't think LCD/LED technology is very reliable, the salesman told me 1 out of the 3 of his Samsung TV's developed a problem and my daughter has a Samsung that has a problem after 2 years.  I expect this brand is about as good as it gets which in my opinion isn't good enough for the prices. That being said I made sure to buy an extended warranty and purchased it from a local store to ensure easier service.EASE OF SETUP - SO/SOPutting this TV together is easier if you've put one together in the past as the instructions and illustrations were low quality.  One of those big instruction sheets that come with some computers and electronics would have been helpful.  The stand and TV went together without too much effort though.  For some reason the electrical plug didn't fit into my existing surge protector, I didn't explore it further but just plugged it into a different one which was fine and probably a better idea.  The connections on the back are very flat which made it hard to screw in my antenna connection.  Everything plugs in so that it is as flat as possible which I'm sure is nice if you're mounting it on the wall. Getting the TV settings the way you like is also easier if you've messed with these TV's before, I got through it with a little trial and error pushing buttons and going through menus.  The setup instructions are almost non existent and I didn't find the onscreen instruction manual answered any of the questions I had.  However all this was fairly simple and in little more than an hour I had it put together, figured out and pretty much set up the way I wanted except for the networked functions which I saved for another day.NETWORKED APPSThe network applications that I've used work great. I don't have a wireless network in my home and it was no problem to plug in an ethernet cable.  I bought a hub but couldn't get the TV connection going with it so instead I've been un-plugging my computer when I want to watch networked shows.  I expect I can fix this somehow in the future.  There seems to be quite a few applications to choose from in addition to Netflix, Hulu and Vudu. Setting up the apps is like loading apps on your phone. I've watched a few things off random free applications in addition to several Netflix movies.  This ability was why I chose this TV and I'm very happy with the ease of use and quality.  Your internet connection and the apps you choose to watch will affect quality of course.IN GENERALThe picture is crisp, better than my Visio was.  It does require some tweaking on settings which my Visio did not, as it was set up very well out of the box. I like the way the remote is laid out. I love the fact that you can get a list of what's playing on each channel, I wasn't expecting that. The picture is good, I'm happy with the settings.  I haven't quite figured out the motion blur control which is supposed to be an option and I've messed with it but still seem to get a slight motion blur occasionally.  I'm very happy with my purchase so far.  The price on Amazon is better but I didn't want to have to mess with shipping if anything happens to the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality with decent price range
Reviews.Author: Maninee
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV through amazon about a 2 weeks ago. I had gone through other reviews before we purchased this one. We were looking for nice TV over 3 months and had gone to all different stores for comparison (next to each other) before we nailed down to Samsung LED TV. Picture quality is great and SOunce Quality is good too.. I had read that sound reviews before but we feel comfortable with the sound quality for this TV. Obviosuly, picture quality is crystal clear on HD channels then regular one. Can't wait for NFL season to start as while watching any game on this TV, feels like you are actually there at the stadium.Only thing, I would suggest that wish they had keyboard on remote control itself instead of typing keyboard on TV as sometime typing this way becomes tedious and time consuming. Rest, internat connection and otehr cable connections were easy and even with Wired Internet connection, getting on internet is flawless. We also own another Samsung TV but not as big as this one and have no complains for Samsung TV qulaity overall. Thanks to all providing a positive/Negative feedback in the past which made our purchase easier.

Reviews.Title: Xcellent TV!
Reviews.Author: John C. Mims
Reviews.Content: Xcellent TV, light, thin, easy to wall mount.  CRYSTAL CLEAR picture, great audio, and plenty of HDMI inputs.  Works great as bedroom TV, perfect fit form and function.  Very easy to setup and get on wireless network.

Reviews.Title: Needs a Sound Upgrade
Reviews.Author: AudioFile
Reviews.Content: I love the picture quality on this set and I've had no issues with the back lighting.  The sound quality, however, is poor and no amount of tinkering with the limited audio controls can make it sound natural.  I've got a pretty awesome audio system, but there are times when I just want to turn on the TV and listen.  You don't need 20 grand of audio to watch the local news.  But the sound quality from this TV is horrible to the point of being un-listenable.If you're going to buy this set, you'll get a great picture but you'll definitely need either an outboard sound system or a sound bar.I with it had more than one Toslink outputand standard RCA jacks instead of adapters.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: JonnyZ
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung I've purchased in 3 months through Amazon. My first was a 55" and now the 46". You can't go wrong with this TV and the price. Everyone that comes over to my house can't believe how clear and sharp everything looks and also how thin it is. I would say the only negative thing that people say is that it has the soap opera effect to it. At first everything did seem a little strange because everything you've watched in the past now looks totally different. But there's a positive side to this...you get used to it and it's amazing!

Reviews.Title: Applications have problem !
Reviews.Author: Ataturk
Reviews.Content: I like this TV - its sleek, picture quality is great! especially when you watch HD documentaries; but when you switch to Internet TV, it messes up everything! I logged in to Netflix mostly, when it was downloading movies, sometimes screen turned into black for a second and this happened several times..Over all, I can recommend this TV for everyone looking for a PS3 console, a pc monitor and more ! The easiest way for Internet TV is to connect Ethernet Cable(3-5$) between your router and TV, dont pay for the wireless connector! And download speed may drop by electro-magnetic waves' interference and losses when using wireless.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Television
Reviews.Author: William Tillery
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of this TV is excellent. Out of the box I was impressed but with a few adjustments it is perfect. Here are the basic settings I used (calibrated while watching Inception).Auto Motion Plus: Blur Reduction 8; Judder Reduction 3. (This was the setting that made the most difference. It improved overall picture quality while eliminating the "video" effect.)These settings are really more a matter of taste:Picture Mode: DynamicBacklight: 20Contrast: 100Brightness: 55Sharpness: 55Color: 55Tint: G50  R50Color Tone: StandardThere are plenty of additional settings to tweak the picture to your heart's content.I set the sound mode to "movie". The sound quality is about what I expected from TV speakers. Audiophiles will of course want a separate sound system.To take advantage of the Smart Hub features wirelessly, you will need to purchase a separate wireless LAN adapter. Another option is to have a Blu-ray player that has internet capabilities. I have the Panasonic DMP-BDT210 Integrated-Wi-Fi 3D Blu-ray DVD Player which I highly recommend.Overall, I could not be happier with this TV. I wanted a small TV with excellent picture quality and that is exactly what I got.

Reviews.Title: I'm Satisfied!
Reviews.Author: W. COOLEY "bilco"
Reviews.Content: I've had my Samsung UN46D6000 for 2 months, and I'm very happy with it. No shakiness or edge brightness issues. I use it for "mirroring" my laptop, so that I can use a cordless keyboard and mouse, and have the luxury of sitting in my recliner chair while enjoying a 46" computer monitor. I recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Like it!
Reviews.Author: Net Get
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied so far.  Picture is beautiful. Only shortcoming is the sound could be a bit better... then this set would be 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40 inch LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Dorothy
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this TV, but anything is an improvement over what I had.  The quality of the sound could be better.  Overall I have no complaints.  In time, I will get accessories installed.  I have had the TV less than a month and it has only been connected a little over 2 weeks.  As time goes by I will give a better evaluation.

Reviews.Title: Fine TV but colors are unnatural
Reviews.Author: George Nevis
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this TV other than the colors. I find them unrealistic, a bit 'cartoonish'. It helps a lot if you change the settings from 'Normal' to 'Natural', but still far from real 'natural'.Otherwise it's a fine TV, everything works well.I'm not sure I'd buy it again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the Money
Reviews.Author: Igor
Reviews.Content: If you want a great picture and don't need or want 3D this is a nice TV.It is very thin and looks great.  The only problems are the speakers will cause the back of the monitor to vibrate and make an obnoxious noise.  Not sure how to fix this, but hopefully Samsung has an answer

Reviews.Title: Brand New TV now won't turn on after just 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Jack Sparrow
Reviews.Content: Just bought this TV during Thanksgiving sale, liked it and watched it until yesterday, when the TV went on stand-by and now it doesn't turn on. Searching the web led me to believe it's a common problem with Samsung TVs in general where the capacitor burns-out. I notice the power light blinking 5 times with a gap of a second or two, then hear a clicking noise, and this repeats w/o the TV turning on. Talked to Amazon customer support regd replacement, but now they don't have any in stock (from Amazon itself). If there is none available till my return period (end of Jan) the only option I have is to return it.

Reviews.Title: Less than 3 years old and died
Reviews.Author: Darren
Reviews.Content: Purchased for $1700 less than 3 years ago and colored lines vertical and thin black lines horizontal on screen. Samsung tech says it would be cheaper to buy new tv as part would cost $800 unless Samsung Executive Customer Care will pay for repair. They contacted me after a week to say they would only offer me 10% discount if I bought new samsung TV or rebate on the $800 part if I went with that..I bought new non samsung tv..$1700 tv should last longer than less than 3 years!!!

Reviews.Title: LED panel cracked on its own in less than 6 months
Reviews.Author: Howard Ji
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Costco less than 6 Months ago. About a week ago, the LED panel cracked internally on its own while not in use and I was at work. Samsung sent a tech to my house and said it's a physical damage and won't be covered by warranty. The tech said something must had hit the screen even though there's no sign of damage on the protective glass. The truth is: we didn't do a thing to the TV and we didn't see a thing happened to TV. Talked to Costco and Samsung over the phone again. The only thing they said was: sorry but there's nothing they can do. I googled "Samsung TV internal crack" and I found it happened more often than one may think. Even though I still believe it's rare because Samsung must have sold millions of these things. The problem I have with them is: they simply deny any possibility that this may be caused by their design or manufacturing defects. I asked them if they could take my TV and do a failure analysis and they denied also. And they offer no solutions.

Reviews.Title: "Like New" from Amazon Warehouse...Excellent Value!
Reviews.Author: Jay1980
Reviews.Content: We purchased a UN46D6000 from the Amazon Warehouse, and saved approx. $200 off of retail.  After owning this TV for about one month, I can say that I would have paid full price.The factory default picture settings were a bit too bright, and the backlighting was at a full 20 level.  This caused bright spots in the corners, which was distressing at first.  I bumped-down the backlighting to 8, decreased the brightness level a bit, and switched to "Dynamic" picture mode.  This resulted in a great picture, with some of the truest black levels that I've seen.  I had also noticed some periodic jitter/motion blur with my Xbox 360, but switching its HDMI inout to "Gaming Mode" cleared everything up.Overall, I'd say that the out-of-the-box/default settings of this TV were terrible--but some setting adjustments easily made the picture quality outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy for the aps!
Reviews.Author: EJoot
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I love the TV. I also have an 55 inch, LG, LCD TV. The Samsung 55 inch LED is better. However, I specifically purchased this TV for my living room so I could stream hockey games from the NHL GameCenter Live Ap. Don't waste your time. You can sign in once and then you'll get locked out of your account for three to four weeks. I called Samsung immediately thinking there was some sort of bug that just needed ironing out. They told me that they knew of the problem and when they fix it, the "smart hub" system will automatically update and correct it. I waited a few weeks...nothing; I waited a few months...nothing; there are 15 games in the season for my team and the Ap still doesn't work. In summary, the TV is great, but the reason I purchased it has proved to be a waste of $1500.00 - something I'm still in trouble for with my wife. Don't buy this TV for the Aps; they are a scam! Dissapointed in Samsung's lack of effort to correct a known problem.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture and Quality
Reviews.Author: Steven D. Harwood
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the ease of setup and familiarizing myself with its' controls.  I'm glad I did my research and found a TV that surpassed my expectations.  My kids love playing XBOX on this TV and I enjoy watching them play games on it.  The resolution is really sharp.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46D60000 46-inch LED HDTV... Amazing Quality and Attributes!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: After a year of researching TVs and drooling at department store displays, I finally made my purchase a month ago. Yes, it does seem like a long time before deciding, but my 15-year-old, 45-inch TV just wouldn't die, and it produced a fine-looking picture. However, with the advancements in technology, I finally relented and purchased the Samsung 46-inch LED HDTV, and what a surprisingly perfect decision made. The overall ownership experience of this Smart TV, along with the picture quality and the unbeatable price, is astounding.The most attractive features of this Samsung TV are:1. picture quality and the backlighting with its crisp, vibrant, clear colors and full HD 1080p;2. beautifully-constructed exterior of the TV with its elegant, sleek design;3. network connectivity (wireless LAN adapter purchased separately) and its added entertainment with the Smart TV and Samsung apps;4. 4 HDMI inputs (although I need 8);5. compatibility and integration with other Samsung products owned, i.e. home entertainment and Blu-ray, etc.;6. Auto Motion plus 120Hz (I enjoy this feature immensely although it's not consistent, which other reviewers have stated);7. functionality and ease of use with the plug and play;8. and not to mention, unlike other flat screen TVs, the built-in speakers are adequate enough to enjoy the audio output (you could hold off buying external speakers or a home entertainment unit if you're not a bass enthusiast like me--I need my subwoofer).Overall, this Samsung UN46D6000 LED HDTV is a first-rate, exceptional product. It totally exceeds my quality, performance, and functionality expectations! Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: High Priced Samsung 32" TV
Reviews.Author: Barbara L.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this high priced 32" TV (UN32D6000)based on Samsung's reputation for quality and reliability along with the fact that I have absolutely no patience for things that don't work properly and have strange quirks. What I received was a LED TV where the picture is AMAZING when you are looking at a program that is broadcasting in HD. If not, the picture is alot less clear than my old Samsung DLP!  Not good.  There are two other things that irk me with this TV.  One of them is that every now and then when you turn on the TV there is a big black thick line that goes vertically across the picture.  If I turn it off and on again, it disappears.  Hmmm.....  Then there is the fact that I can't seem to get the picture to display correctly and occupy the entire screen.  I find myself fiddling with it all the time.  Again not good.  For a high end expensive 32" TV, I would have expected more.  The sound is excellent and it does have internet capabilities like Netflix, etc, but don't forget to buy the wireless lan adapter which isn't included (that information must have been in the small print, since I missed it!)and it isn't cheap...hence the 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Wayne Hastings "Wayne"
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this TV. The picture is unbelievably clear. The actors seem to pop from the screen in HD as well as old B&W; streaming movies and DVDs. It' simply incredible The packaging relates that this is a 240Mhz, not 120 as the description says so that must be the reason.I replaced a five-year-old Sony LCD with this Samsung and I'm glad I did. The Sony didn't last as long as we hoped developing read and green horizontal lines. Terribly disappointed with Sony quality.The Samsung has one small disadvantage. Unlike the LCD, the clear screen and LED does produce glare from lighting. We got used to a "non-glare" picture and it's hard to go back to seeing people and lights in the picture. The picture quality helps to overcome the issue, but, if you have a lot of light, it may be a problem for you.Also disappointed in Amazon's pricing policies. They do NOT price match TVs. We bought this just a couple of weeks ago and it's gone down $90. Amazon won't do anything for us. That hurts.Overall, I recommend it, just watch the lights and pricing.

Reviews.Title: excellent TV
Reviews.Author: med29
Reviews.Content: The experience with this TV is nice. I have no problem. The price was a little high but amazon is running the special so it's more reasonable now.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: mz "mz"
Reviews.Content: great deal with free shipping, saved over 150 dollars compared to every one elses sale price. tv was easy to set up, arrived with not even a crease in the shipping box. great picture but like all other flat screens I needed to hook it up to my stereo to get real good sound.

Reviews.Title: LCDs have come a long way and this tv proves it
Reviews.Author: Hen
Reviews.Content: In 2008 I bought a smaller Samsung LCD that was highly reviewed at the time.  In between I bought a 46 inch Sony LCD which I resold at a loss because of all of the problems I had with it, even after Sony replaced the entire tv.  Not only does this tv have an amazing crisp picture from wide viewing angles, but it's light, razor thin, and it's got all of the built in services like Netflix that I use all of the time.  Plus, the picture is highly adjustable so that you can tailor it to your media and viewing preferences.  Hands down this is the best tv I've purchased to date and, if it's anything like the other Samsung tv I bought it will hold up and maintain its picture for several years to come.  Amazon also did a great job on the delivery and it was as pain free as such a large package can be.

Reviews.Title: Still Getting Used to It - Remote a Little Dicey
Reviews.Author: M. Rowe
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Samsung UN40D6000 this past Sunday while Sears had a great sale - our first HDTV!  After reading all the reviews and learning how "easy" it was going to be to install this TV, we started with confidence that this project wasn't going to take too long.  Well, today we began and from the time we opened the box to sitting down and watching a program it was at least 3 hours later. My husband lost a few hairs over setting this TV up plus we ended up needing to call our cable company to help us set up that end of it.  Once the cable company told us to remove a label over the HDMI input we inserted the HDMI cable and Voila! the whole landscape changed!  Before that discovery we were struggling with on-screen green people and a buzz that wouldn't go away.  We found the menu on the remote to not be too friendly PLUS in order to learn anything about the TV you had to go to the on-screen E-Manual by pushing the button on the remote!  I want that information in my hands not on the screen or at least have it on line where I can print it out later!  Anyway, we still have to install our Samsung Blu-ray player and hope that it will be a bit easier than the TV was.  Now that we have had our lunch we are now able to add a few positive comments:  beautiful picture, bright with natural skin colors, sound is fine (may add speakers or sound bar later), and picture big enough for viewing 9 feet away and not too big for viewing a bit closer.  So far, we are happy with our TV.  I will report back if anything else comes up we weren't expecting.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful unit, great picture - only issue was internet
Reviews.Author: Raffles
Reviews.Content: We've had great experience with Samsung quality before, so we decided on this unit even though others were a bit cheaper. It has not disappointed... the picture quality is terrific, and the TV itself is thin, beautiful & practically disappears, as you feel you are seeing only the picture.Plenty of inputs for all devices... but this is where we ran into our only problem. It is not nearly clear enough when purchasing that if you want wireless internet connection for the Smart TV features, you must have a wireless USB adapter, which does not come with this model (it does with the next sizes up). That's another $80 to buy. We did that, and even then it was near impossible to connect with the router through the Settings menus. Finally gave up and tried a different solution, which was to purchase Ethernet connectors for the electrical outlets (another $100). That set up automatically in seconds, and has worked perfectly. Netflix works great. But the design and organization of the Smart TV features seem way too complex and difficult to navigate.But as far as all usual TV functions & using for Netflix, it's just great.

Reviews.Title: Clear/Crisp Picture
Reviews.Author: VanAcct09
Reviews.Content: This has an awesome picture and good sound for factory speakers. I still need to do some research for the best settings but I'm loving it so far - really recommend sticking to Blu-Ray on it though...anything less than that reminds me of VCR days because all the flaws of the film are so obvious :). Great TV

Reviews.Title: This is living the good life.
Reviews.Author: mary mackenzie
Reviews.Content: Can you be in love with your tv?I will watch anything on this tv, it is so beautiful and the picture is so fantastic  (HD channels).It is just like being at the movies, you feel you are in the movie.Before I bought this tv, I hardly watched tv.It is like when you are a kid and you get a new toy that you want to play with all the time.(I do work full time and exercise!)

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55D6000 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: someone2 "someone2"
Reviews.Content: ProsPicture quality is amazing (HD format). Connect DVR with HDMI only. The wrinkles of the old lady from Titanic who throws the precious stone into the ocean looked terrifying to my 7 year old!TV Speakers are very powerful. Better than LG.ThinVery nice, stylish designInternet enabled.Cons:Shipping took a week. Received it after 11 days.Lack of software internet browser!!! I will look for alternative in Samsung app store. But it should be there for the users by default.YouTube app has no parental control by default. YouTube app will play what is currenlty in the queue. Be aware parents!Not very intiuitive navigation through SMART screen. Lack of QUERTY keyborad. Samsung software keyborad is a joke. You press wrong button, you have to do it all over again.No Divx support. (LG has it)non HD content tends to be blurry.Problems with FIOS Actiontec router, FIOS had to ship another 802.11g router to me just to get pandora streaming. Samsung recommends 802.11n. Neflix is rebuffering from time to time on 802.11g network on a new router FIOS shipped, showing 80% strength quality. Note: I was able to stream Neflix through Wii with no problems before.WiFi adapter sold seperately, you will pay additional $55 to get connected to internet access. "WiFi ready" means you can plug USB Samsung adapter only.Screen is difficult to clean once you get so called "sweat stains" on it. I did when I hanged it up by myself on Cheetah mount. Get low profile mount for this TV.I wish SOURCE button was called INPUT. Spent some time to find it. Remote control is bulky.Screws are not provided by Samsung. Cheetag screws are too long. You would need to run to HomeDepot... What a pain.Giving it 4 stars only.

Reviews.Title: Samsumg 55" LED
Reviews.Author: S. Hull "ssm"
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome.  The picture is amazing and the colors are great.  Easy to set up as far as TV is concerned.  Have not got to the WiFi part yet though.  Just hope it lasts alot longer than my previous Toshiba Plasma which gave out after 5 years.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV's have major issue with White Dots popping up after a year or two
Reviews.Author: Viewer "cityview"
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware on all Samsung TV's.  I have white dots popping up all over my screen from a faulty chip which Samsung refuses to fix.  A quick google search on the white dot issue will show you this is a major problem and Samsung customers such as myself are fuming.

Reviews.Title: Writing this review after using 19 months
Reviews.Author: Chandan Pau;
Reviews.Content: I did purchase this TV from Amazon, initially the TV worked extremely great. Suddenly exactly after an year, TV started flickering. I contacted Samsung care and they declined to provide service because it was out of warranty. Also they provided service center details who can help provide paid service. I called those guys and just to check the TV, they charged $75. Without touching the TV, they told me the display panel is wrong. He also provided estimate of $600(part) + $150 (labor) to replace the panel. I reached out to Samsung again and no luck. Finally I had no way, but to recycle the expensive Samsung LED TV(46 inch):-(I am really unhappy with the fact. Recommendation is always buy insurance while making such purchase else your condition will be like me :-(

Reviews.Title: Light Bleeding first, Horizontal lines within a year. Don't Buy!
Reviews.Author: Aidux
Reviews.Content: Since the first day we purchased the TV, corners were bleeding the light (watching dark scenes the light was shining through the corners).  As time went by, the lights in the corners intensified and now on the top of that we have few green lines and several dark grey lines that stretches from the top right corner along the screen. They are sharper at the corner and dim as they stretch from right to left. Samsung does not cover the problem since 12 months already passed :(

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40D6000 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Roxanne
Reviews.Content: The Samsung HDTV-love it, especially when you connect the HDMI cable, images look like 3D.  I am in the process of getting a wireless router for the Smart Apps-catch wait to use!

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price!!!
Reviews.Author: omok
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research on getting a flat panel TV from Amazon.  It took three weeks but I finally settled on the UN55D6000.  Came with the "White Glove" shipping, which basically means Amazon contracts out the shipping to a company because its a high priced item.  Their communication with me was excellent and even offered to deliver it a day early.  I plugged it into my entertainment system and it was great.  I did have to make a few setting adjustments (clear motion turned off) but other than that, it's everything I hoped it would be.  Would buy again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: This TV is really good
Reviews.Author: Ramesh
Reviews.Content: Hi,I have been using this TV for last one month and it's really amazing in picture quality. I feel it's worth i spent on this TV by purchasing from Amazon.com

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED Review
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: This TV is exactly as advertised and has a very high quality picture.  I also have purchased Sharp and I find them comparable. This SAmsung was less expensive for the same size as the Sharp so I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Not What I expected
Reviews.Author: Jason M. Kluczyk "theklu"
Reviews.Content: First, I bought this TV because I tested the UN32D5500 TV with my computer which worked great.  I figured I would get more goodies with this model but it didn't deliver for what I needed.  I am basically using this product as a computer monitor that I just use for internet and movies.  Also, I use it with xbox which did work really well.  When I tested the 5500 model, there was no on screen lag and that model was smooth.  So, I figured I would get this model with more options and the 5,000,000 to 1 ratio.  For the life of me, I could not get rid of a weird lag it was causing on as a pc display (again, this problem wasn't in the 5500).As for this TV being a TV, it was excellent.  The picture is astonishing.  The overall appearance of the Tv is so modern.  It's so sleek, skinny, and I love the trim.In all, the one thing this tv lacked was the way it reacted with my computer.  With xbox, movies, and tv, it was great.  I figured it would react the way it did with the one model version down from this one but it didn't. Unfortunately, my PC serves as the hub of my entertainment, and this set didn't deliver.Amazon free ship of TVs back is awesome.  I was stressing about returning this but found out about free shipping back, how cool is that???

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46" Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Don Ewald "Drag Racer"
Reviews.Content: After jumping through some hoops to get everything set up this TV rocks. But in hind sight, I would not have gotten a "Smart TV" as I really don't need/use those functions. The Samsung w/o the smart part would have saved me $300.00.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: H. Stafford
Reviews.Content: Has everything you need for a home enough hdmi inputs and usb inputs to hook everything directly to your tv wasnt interested in 3d so this was perfect for me and for the price i caught it at on amazon a great value.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: chria
Reviews.Content: The picture is great. The menus are easy to navigate and the wide range of applications make this tv fun to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV
Reviews.Author: Srini Gottipati
Reviews.Content: This is my first HD TV and has done lot of research before purchase and I am completely satisfied with the this TV. Good Apps, Nice frequency Big Thing in Big Package..

Reviews.Title: A fluke
Reviews.Author: Lourdesmac
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item after researching various brands, price was not much of an issue, I was not interested in the 3D.I purchased this item at a local chain store, on sale. I was able to fit the box in my Toyota Camry, between the passenger seats. Taking it out of the box and setting it up was less then 3 minutes, very simple. Once I set it up it ran a bunch of updates.The next morning, lines appeared from the top running down as if it was bleeding, all across the screen. Needless to say, I was very upset and now didn't trust the brand anymore. When I returned it, the sales person said "that it was a fluke that he's never seem something like this before".I exchanged it for the 3D model only because it was a newer model and it was on special for the same price!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Grent
Reviews.Content: I love this product. The quality of the display is crisp and sound quality is good. I almost felt like for some HD movies, I am watching it in 3d without the glasses. The interface is good and I can easily navigate to the different features of the TV. Another cool feature is how I can plug in my portable hard disk and watch movies and my favorite photo slideshow.My only negative feedback would be that since they are advertising this as a smart TV, I would assume that wifi connectivity is built in. But instead I have to buy another device to plug in to my TV for that to work. And since I am on a budget still, I can't afford that now.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 LED TV
Reviews.Author: M. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: I have had the product for several months now and it works fine. Picture and sound are good. Because it is LED, it has a glare/reflection from windows when viewed from a side angle during daytime. I have not used the various "smart" features, so I can not comment on them. I have other Samsung LCD/LED TVs, and I am satisfied with all of them including this one.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: This tv has an excellent picture...even with 1080i which directv has there HD. The only reason for the 4 stars is the sound quality. It is great until you break 20. Then it gets real cracky. For the price it is an excellent buy. Great energy saver as well.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Rajiv Bhopani
Reviews.Content: Purchased this beauty about 2 months ago and it has extremely satisfied my needs. Plays everything in top quality LED

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46D6000
Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV through Amazon 4 months ago. Picture is excellent side veiw is ok, glare is'nt to bad, we have it in a room with lots of windows. Don't use it for the apps. Bought the dong to hook up to internet. Can't view You Tube at all as pausing all the time. Don't use netflix so can't comment on that. Excellent TV for the picture sound not to bad. We bought sound bar for it improves the sound a lot. Need an upgrade on the apps as pretty useless as they are now.

Reviews.Title: No need to keep looking
Reviews.Author: Mr. Johnnyvegas
Reviews.Content: Tv is awesome for the price. So glade I spent the extra couple of hundred for an LED TV . Its so much better than Lcd. Football season is going great now. This is a must buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Keith Liskey
Reviews.Content: This Samsung LED Smart TV has a great picture, is very thin and light for mounting, and has a very thin bezel which is a primary reason I selected it because I had limited space, and other 46 inch TV's have those wide bezels which unnecessarily oversize the TV.  I have several TV's and a home front projection home theatre.  All have good HD pictures, but this one is the best and brightest.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Panel
Reviews.Author: Gregory Slonim "Greg"
Reviews.Content: This is my second 40" panel from Samsung. I bought a 6500 series panel last year and have been pretty happy with it. A good experience with my existing tv plus limited choices in smart tv category prompted me to purchase this one when I needed a new TV for the kitchen. Long story short:Like: - picture quality - smart interface and ability to have access to multiple content providers - dnla and ability to stream from any computer or NAS on the home network - ease of network configuration and WIFI setup with an optional USB wifi adapter - iPhone app For remote control - incredibly thin - did I mention picture quality?No Like:- WTF with the absence of the Yahoo widget and why can I not install it on this tv? You cannot access Amazon Prime without Yahoo app. Beware of this limitation. I am still like "WTF"- shiny glossy screen reflects everything like my Mac does :). Do not put in front of windows :-) the screen makes picture prettier though- movies sound like crap. You can barely hear the dialog no matter what sound setting. You will probably use external speaker though. Regular cable content sounds fine.- some inevitable light bleed (clouding). Inevitable because of the edge lit LED. Most tvs equipped with that technology will exhibit light bleeding on very dark scenes.Overall: great tv, good remote, excellent picture, and networking capabilities. I am still perplexed with the Yahoo widget and amazon prime situation.

Reviews.Title: Love my new TV
Reviews.Author: gasman
Reviews.Content: We received our new TV about a month ago. The assembly and setup were pretty easy. This TV is for our bedroom, and I get my signal via an HD antenna I purchased from Walmart for $30 (I do not have HD satellite hookup in our bedroom yet).  We have also watched Blu-ray and PS3 games and the picture is just absolutely amazing. The only negatives we have found so far are the pictures of old TV shows appear as though they are soap operas ( I think its the 120 mhz effect and haven't figured out how to change it).  The other minor issue is on the remote, the enter button is nowhere near the number buttons, so you have to wait for the channel to change once you enter the channel number (no problem if you have cable/satellite remote).  We highly recommend this TV to anyone considering it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: M. Beezy
Reviews.Content: This TV is the best. I got a great deal with Amazon, they said it was going to take 2 weeks to send, I got it in 1 week. Great deal great TV.I use this to watch movies on an htpc, xbox. It has network access on the back for watching netflix. The apps aren't that great, but I have a computer for what it doesn't do.Very happy with this led tv.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Pari
Reviews.Content: Adv: 1) Very nice TV....picture quality is amazing 2) Other features also too good. 3) Networking with Iphone and Laptop is good ( with ethernet port or wireless USB Adapter)Dislikes:THis is not disadvantage of TV..But my personal dislikes. I don't see much useful with internet samsung apps available..especially when we need to give inputs by TV remote. Frustrating. Netflix is good but not Youtube. But this should not stop us buying this TV.

Reviews.Title: UN46D6000 LED TV
Reviews.Author: RJH
Reviews.Content: Picture Is Great. The Sound Volume Could Use Some work. You Have To Put The Volume To The 25 Setting To Hear It Across The Room.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price - you can't go wrong!
Reviews.Author: pddaddy1959
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to upgrade to a flat screen for some time, but I'm glad I waited.  The picture quality on this TV is fantastic.  As another reviewer said, once you turn it on you won't want to turn it off! Wireless dongle works flawlessly with my home wireless G-network - no buffering or stuttering, even though my wireless router is two floors away. (Did have initial problems connecting to Netflix, but resetting the  TV to factory specs fixed the issue. FYI, fixes a LOT Of issues.)  There is a huge and growing amount of free or very inexpensive content on line, so the Smart TV capabilities are really worth it.Not sure what others are seeing in the corners, but my unit looks great.  And I don't see any judder at all, though I'm watching TimeWarner HD most of the time, and that signal is only 60 hz.  I will soon upgrade to a Blueray player and we'll see if that's an issue.Don't think you can go wrong with this TV!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Terry Spearman
Reviews.Content: I did a fair bit of research before selecting this TV.  Samsung seemed to be well reviewed, and I own a couple of 24" Samsung computer monitors that I thought were good value and I've had no issues with.  I thought the TV was good value as well, and I have not been dissappointed with it.  The picture is extemely good with a hi-def signal.  I find I have to tone down the factory pre-sets a bit to get things to my liking, but the number of parameters that can be adjusted is very good.  Anyone should be able to tailor the picture to their liking.  I have not yet hooked it up to the internet, so I can't speak to that, but I intend to in order to take advantage of Netflix.  I've only had it for a couple of weeks, so I can't speak to its durability, but I've had the computer monitors for a couple of years without problems so I'm hoping for the best.

Reviews.Title: Great TV-Motion Plus Issues...
Reviews.Author: BiLLxKozb3
Reviews.Content: Wow! This TV is awesome! Great picture, and the menu is very user friendly. Although, to every great there is a flip side. Auto Motion Plus... I called Samsung about the issue twice, and spoke with technical tier 2 rep about the extreme juddering issues when motion plus is activated. (This being the standard setting to custom.) Sam-bumb said it was the HDMI cable... So, I have four so when not? Used my best $90 Monster cable, and swapped my xbox's - still issues... Called back, and to no avail, Samsung said its not the TV and would not send out a tech for a fix. After digging, and running software test from my IBM to the TV, I have found that the decoder is not up to par, and can't handle processing the info... Since purchasing the unit I have had four firmware updates, and no fixes for the juddering. Come on Samsung!!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Harbour
Reviews.Content: The television arrivee DOA, had to send it back, can't give any favorable comments as it was not a favorable experience.

Reviews.Title: who sells a tv without a warranty
Reviews.Author: Timothy F Thierry
Reviews.Content: I must of had been crazy to buy this from you don't want me to contact you about this tv then who your great when i'm buying but now jusy a year old amazom I don't know about you guys I will be contacting you next If I could only write what I want to write it would not be nice I would not buy anything from these people I was thinking about buying a 60"for myself and giving this one to my daughter but you lost out on another sale this won't make to a rating so no one will even see this but there are other ways to get the word out about you guys

Reviews.Title: Disposable TV
Reviews.Author: Juliana Guzman
Reviews.Content: Remove one star for the very bad sound system and the rest since the screen began to fail after only 15 months. Half the screen flickers and has no color. Had it checked by a samsung technician today and he basically said that you need to replace the screen (which with labor is more expensive then the TV itself) and since the warranty expired he said that the TV is now pretty much garbage. Since there is absolutely nothing I can do I am out $2000 and no TV.

Reviews.Title: Marina
Reviews.Author: Marina Sennet
Reviews.Content: Under NO CIRCUMSTANCES would I EVER Buy a Samsung TV again! I owned a 32 inch LCD that had the capacitor problem. I called the customer service number and, after being disconnected no fewer than EIGHT times, was told by various customer service reps that 1) a service person would contact me for in home service (never happened) 2) I needed to ship the TV back to them UPS to have it repaired 3) they would issue me a $300 refund 4) no, they won't issue a refund 5) they have a service man available to fix it but not at a time I can arrange so.... basically they make a poor quality product and when their customer service doesn't disconnect you, they tell you conflicting and incorrect things. I'm putting the damned thing by the side of the road because it will cost me less to replace it than to take the time off work to have their "free" repair. NEVER AGAIN. Tell everyone you know.

Reviews.Title: The only TV I've ever LOVED
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I've bought many TVs in my lifetime, but this one is by far the only one I've actually ever LOVED. It's beautiful and sleek and presents an excellent, crisp picture. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, not so smart
Reviews.Author: vertigo_2_20
Reviews.Content: This TV has an excellent picture quality, with extremely deep blacks (a common weakness of LCD/LED TVs) and little to no issues with backlight bleed, at least not noticeable without looking very closely. As with most/all LCD/LED TVs, this one has the issue where motion looks odd, like a home video camera. Some people like this, I personally find it distracting. However, for the most part it's not a big issue, partly due to the fact this TV unlike many others allows for separate adjustment of judder and blur reduction. I also like the fact the TV has DLNA support and a built-in Netflix app, however, as you'll see below, these both have major flaws.Unfortunately, as nice as this TV looks, both physically and the picture, it has far too many big drawbacks for me to give it a good review. The first that came to my attention was that if you use the audio out jack (I'm using a set of Logitech 2.1 speakers with it for compactness, as I'm only at my current residence for a few months, so it's not worth setting up my HT), you can't control the volume through the TV. They could have easily made it linked to the TVs volume, but instead they decided to save $0.50 or whatever, and now I have to adjust it on the speakers themselves. The next issues that appeared were the TV/apps crashing when watching Hulu (and I think the TV itself crashed when on another source, but I don't remember now, though I do know the whole TV actually restarted at at least one point). Also, the TV is just extremely slow: It takes forever once powered on before it's usable, and browsing connected hard drives is borderline agonizing. As if this isn't bad enough, many times when you go to the Smart menu, you have to wait several minutes while it downloads/installs updates for the apps, without asking you, and even if you don't want most of the apps in the first place, which is another issue of its own. When I want to sit down and watch a Netflix movie, I want to do it when I turn the TV on, not 5-10 minutes later after it's done doing what it wants to do. Samsung should have made the option to do this at the user's time of choosing, possibly when the TV is turned off (could turn the screen off and leave the TV on long enough to do what it needs to do, then power off completely).Also, when watching Netflix, it will sometimes stutter excessively, loading every 1-2 seconds, and the other day it was even worse and when it happened my computer, which is connected, started to act like it was having an external display constantly connected and disconnected, which leads me to believe the TV randomly started cycling through inputs "behind the scenes," messing with both the computer and the displaying of the stream. Yet other times when Hulu, being streamed from my computer via PlayOn, hits a commercial the stream will just stop. When these various issues have cropped up, I have started watching it with either my computer, using the TV as a monitor, or with my PS3, and both ways I've never had a problem. This indicates a major issue with their Netflix app and with their software DLNA server compatibility, as it obviously doesn't work terribly well with PlayOn, though probably 85-90% of the time it's fine.Yet another problem I've had with the TV is two or three times I've turned it off, watched the LED light on the TV go solid on, as it does when the TV is off, then watch as the TV turns itself back on, all on its own. That's just unacceptable. Finally, the limited PiP functionality is a real disappointment. I thought I would be able to do things like have it acting like a secondary monitor while watching a TV channel in the corner, or playing a PS3 game on the bottom and watching Hulu on the top. There's no reason these things shouldn't be possible, but they're not. About all you can do with PiP is watch two channels at once on TV.I'm still keeping it, because a lot of the issues didn't really become apparent until past 30 days, and I got an excellent deal on it, but it may be the last Samsung I buy. I have not had good luck with their products, as I have a Galaxy Tab 10.1 that has many software/firmware issues as well; they should stick to displays and not try to make "computers" and software. I'm being generous giving this TV 3 stars. At best, I'd say it's worthy of 2.5. Had I paid full price, I would rate it as 2, because I feel for the money it just would not be worth it and would be a huge slap in the face. However, considering the good deal I got on it, it gives me the main thing I want: 46" of goodness in a small, light form factor. I just hope future offerings by Samsung or others actually take the time to smooth out the edges and realize it's the whole package that matters, and when the software sucks, it doesn't really matter how good the hardware is. Somehow, I don't think Samsung is going to learn that lesson anytime soon, though.Update: I've now owned this TV for 3.5 months, and still have all the same issues. It still occasionally reboots in the middle of what I'm doing and/or starts acting erratically, causing extremely excessive buffering of Hulu/Netflix. It seems to happen after the TV has been on for a while, so it may be an overheating issue. What's strange is that I just switch to using the PS3 and it works fine, so it's not an issue with displaying the picture, just an issue with the network adapter perhaps. My latest issue is that it just now took 4 attempts to launch the Netflix app; each time I tried it would just go to a black screen, and one time it even switched inputs (which it has also been known to do on its own).I realize a lot of these issues may just be my set being a lemon, but in case others are experiencing similar problems, I thought I'd mention them.

Reviews.Content: After waiting for 2 weeks for delivery, Samsung UN46D6000 finally arrived.  Picture quality is very good. Often, I have to turn on the light to use the Remote.  There is only 1 Component Video entry; and it requires a connector adapter (provided). Reviews.Title: Be an Informed Consumer
Reviews.Author: Anonymous "LH"
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased two Samsung Smart TVs - one large and one small for our bedroom. For the most, we liked the TV. Loading the Smart function is slow and the apps are not great, but given the Smart TVs are new, this did not bother us and was not unexpected. Until recently, we would of still given a 5 star rating to both TVs. However, we began having vertical lines on our smaller TV. When I called about getting it serviced (which must be done through Samsung), I was told that because it is a 32 inch TV, I have to mail it in. They will not send technicians to repair a TV under 40 inches, I was told. This is very disappointing. We had this wall mounted. Thus, I have to take it down, remove the mounting, mail the TV to Samsung, reattach the wall mounting when it returns, and hang the TV. It is generally recommended to have a second person to hang a 32-inch TV. I will have to find assistance, again, to hang the TV. Its a pretty good TV when working, but keep in mind that they do not offer good service options if you have a problem. It is important to be an informed consumer and take this into consideration when purchasing any Samsung TV under 40 inches. Personally, I would not consider a Samsung TV under 40 inches based upon the service options. Samsung could and should provide better service. It seems clear that they do not have as strong of a commitment to their TVs under 40 inches. Given this, I will think twice about any purchases from Samsung in the future. The one star rating is based upon service primarily.

Reviews.Title: "Great unit, until something breaks"
Reviews.Author: R. Perez "gadget afficionado"
Reviews.Content: (PLEASE NOTE: This review is not about this tv set, it is mainly about Samsung and the way I was treated with their customer service. I purchased an LN40C650 just over a year ago. The review is posted on that product on Amazon, and I wanted to share my experiences with Samsung for anyone and everyone to see.)------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I want to start off by saying that the Samsung LN40C650 tv set is great. The picture quality is awesome, local and internet streaming work perfectly, and I was extremely satisfied with this unit, until...About a week after my 1 year warranty expired, I began to have problems with the ethernet adapter on the tv. I called Samsung to see what troubleshooting steps I could take to resolve my issue. The problem was that no matter what cable I used or what port on the router was used, the tv could not connect to my network. (Keep in mind that I am a network technician and understand how networks work, and knew exactly what the problem was.) After relaying that same information to multiple agents when calling Samsung, every time I called they wanted me to go through the same troubleshooting steps. I informed them that the problem was with the ethernet adapter on the television. When the tv was plugged in, the router light would never come on, and it would never get an IP address from my router. To test this, I plugged in a laptop using that same cable, and it immediately worked without any problems. So I knew that the ethernet port was the problem and not my router (which I have two routers, and tried both of them).So, after speaking with multiple reps at Samsung, I finally spoke to an agent who I believed was going to help me. Myself and the agent went through the same troubleshooting steps, but still unable to resolve the issue. So he asked if I had registered my product to be eligible to have my warranty extended for 3 months. I told him that I had registered, and he looked up that information successfully. I even received an email stating that my warranty had been extended for three months. The agent then proceeded to get a work order so that a technician would contact me to setup service. At this point, I am under the impression that I will be covered under the extended 3-months. (To make a long story short) I received a call from the Samsung technician in my area, and stated that Samsung did not inform him that my tv was under warranty and stated that Samsung would have to send documentation that it is still under warranty. So I contacted Samsung, once again, and I was told that since the unit was out of the first year warranty, I would not be able to have my tv repaired, and that I would be responsible for the service if I decided to have it serviced. I even forwarded the email that I received about my extended 3 months of warranty to the Samsung rep, and was told that they could not honor that warranty, and I would be responsible for the service.I am not here to bash Samsung for the way I was treated. I understand that I was out of my warranty at the time when I started having issues, and I understand that they technically do not have to provide me with anything. I am simply writing this to inform potential buyers of my issues with this television set and how my issues was 'resolved' by Samsung. This is more to inform you about the company, more than it is about this specific product, which if the one i purchased.I reiterate, this product looks fantastic. It has the ability to stream Netflix, Hulu, MLB.TV, Youtube, etc. I even have a few DLNA applications(such as PlayOn, Twonky, and a Windows Home Server with built in Media Server capabilities) and this television played all of my media (videos, music, and photos) that were located on my server and my main computer.But, please be informed that if you begin to have issues, even just a day out of your warranty, you are on your own.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BE WARNED
Reviews.Author: Psi
Reviews.Content: I got this TV 12 days ago. Right out of the box it was missing the part that connects the TV to the stand. I did the 2 day shipping so I could have the TV before Thanksgiving. When I called Samsung about the part they said that it would take 5 to 12 days for the part to arrive. The I called amazon to see if they sold the part and could ship it out to me. They informed me that if I purchase the part through Samsung and have overnight shipping that Amazon would pay for all of it. I then gave Samsung a call back and they informed me that the part was on back order for the next 1-6 weeks if I ordered the part this way. This makes me think of how many other people had this problem if the same part was on back order. So that was the first time amazon had to clean up Samsung's mess. I have yet to receive the part. On the 11th day the TV picture went out. Gave Samsung yet another call back. I was transferred all over the place. One of those transferred was to a team that was closed and would have to call back. The guy who transferred me gave me his extension to call back. The extension was not even real. This was the worst customer support I have ever received. Amazon has been great through all of this, but I will never purchase another Samsung device again.As far as the TV itself goes:Video: 8/10 - The picture would look rather bad when watching in standard def.Audio:4/10 - I had to hook up speakers as the audio was so low.Reliability: 1/10 - reasons given above.Would I recommend this TV: No.

But when the TV started rebooting itself I thought it strange; after following steps in the manual under the troubleshooting guild, it didn't correct the problem. And the rebooting problem gets worse with time until it's impossible to use the unit at all.I will return this unit to the store, but I will not purchase another SAMSUNG.

Reviews.Title: A very expensive mirror and a lesson learned

Only to find all of the current Samsung models are using a glossy panel, rather than matte.While this might enhance black levels, it's a killer if you have any lighting on in front of the TV when watching, or indeed glare from windows during the day.When I sit in front of my TV, I don't expect to see myself, I expect to see the actual TV picture. Shame on you Samsung for not offering your customers the choice.I returned mine to a certain retail store called BB., who I shall NEVER buy from again. I just discovered they report your return/exchange habits to a third party agency without telling you, by asking for your Driving License every time you shop in the Store, the end result of which can have a very negative result for the customer. It serves me right for not getting it from Amazon in the first place and my replacement will be ordered through Prime in the next few days.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture for the money; after initial frustration...satisfaction
Reviews.Author: wastefaxpro
Reviews.Content: I was initially very frustrated with the inability of Samsung to provide correct information about the screw size needed to mount the TV on a wall mount.The mounting screw required is a M8 15mm 1.25 pitch.  I used a hex bolt from a local big box hardware store with a blue exterior.Once on the wall I found the picture to be very good for the money.I have successfully used the samsung wiso9abgn wireless adapter to connect to an Apple Airport Extreme wireless network.  I followed advice on the net and set my SSID with all lower case letters and the TV accepted my wireless key without trouble.My initial review reflected frustration with poor Samsung customer service and concerns regarding connecting to the wireless network.  Now that those problems have been solved I am happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Author: joemama "GMK"
Reviews.Content: Not impressed at all with the UN40D6000 so called Smart TV. There is no web browser, no way to browse the web, no way to easily enter search terms, and no way to access or receive amazon content, unless you hook up a PC input. Samsung customer service (Tier 2) was disappointing.My main gripe was trying to "type" with the remote - you have to select each letter in the word, its very slow and frustrating, and T9 isn't any better. Samsung doesn't even have a QWERTY remote available for this TV at any price. Searching content or apps was ridiculous with using the remote to type each letter.The TV itself was OK, but the picture was dark unless you went in a adjusted settings for each type of input. Then, don't get me started on updating the software/firmware. Why wouldn't the latest versions from the Samsung site be available to load OTA? Why should I have to mess with a USB drive?I returned the TV today. Got me relatively dumb HDTV, and a roku, and the app on my android is my qwerty keyboard, I'm done with Samsung.
